Written for and premiered at SALTcon 2017 in Layton, UT. SaltCON is the largest Board Game Convention in Utah held annually in Layton at the Davis Conference Center with the "aim of bringing people together with games."

226124.name: Broken Halls of Goldahroud
226124.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Beneath the moorlands of Thar, hidden from all for centuries, lies the Broken Halls of Goldahroud. It seems to have been inhabited until recently as the blood marks on the walls are only a few weeks old. What mysteries lie beyond the doorway from the Tomb of Kered? Fear of the markings have forced the SALT Consortium to turn again to hiring adventurers to face what horrors await them in the Broken Halls of Goldahroud

Note: This adventure allows the DM more choice is adventure layout. It is best read and choices selected prior to running the adventure. With the right selections, this adventure can easily be deadly to even the most advanced tier 1 parties.

A Four-Hour Adventure for 1st-4th level characters.

Optimized for five 2nd level characters.

Written for and premiered at SALTcon 2017 in Layton, UT. SaltCON is the largest Board Game Convention in Utah held annually in Layton at the Davis Conference Center with the "aim of bringing people together with games.

226125.name: Turbo Drift: Ramped Up
226125.description: Turbo Drift: Ramped Up adds another obstacle card to make tracks a little more difficult, two oil slick cards, a sweet 5th player truck and 2 ramps so that you can leap into the air.

226126.name: Find Your Seats: Bonus Appetit
226126.description: Find Your Seats: Bonus Appetit adds SIX new characters, each very different than any we've seen. The Sweet Pea that moves neighbors closer, The Counselor that flips them back over, The Twins that have different personalities on the left and right, The Spy that looks at cards, The Vampire that sucks blood and points, and the Robot that wants specific patterns.

226127.name: Fallout: New Vegas – Courier's Stash
226127.description:
User Summary

It is a compilation of the four item packs that were previously released as bonuses for pre-ordering the game at certain retailers. - Caravan Pack, Classic Pack, Mercenary Pack & Tribal Pack.

226128.name: Gem Hunter
226128.description:
A story-driven action platformer for the HTC Vive and Oculus Rift. Fly your Hovercraft on a quest to recover the Fox King's lost Diamonds and defeat the three Witches! Mine gems, battle creatures, solve mysteries, uncover secrets, build your ship.

Source: The Developer Website.

226129.name: HackyZack
226129.description:
You are Zack. Juggle balls with unique properties through platforming puzzles to a goal at the end of each stage. Help Zack fill his treasured book of stickers to unlock optional challenge levels, where you race against the timer to destroy targets as fast as possible.

Source: The Developer Website.

226130.name: Majotori
226130.description:
If you wish for something really hard, Lariat the Witch might appear and offer to make your wish come true if you win a game of trivia, but if you lose, something bad might happen instead. How many lives will your ignorance ruin?

Source: The Developer Website.

226131.name: Bomb Squad Academy
226131.description:
Save the world one wire at a time with Bomb Squad Academy, a puzzle game where you have to defuse bombs under a time constraint.

Source: The Game Website.

226132.name: Manipulated
226132.description:
Warning! This game does require an ability to think.

Source: The Developer Website.

226133.name: Twisted Arrow
226133.description:
Twisted Arrow is a first-person shooter that gives players adrenaline-packed arcade style action. Armed with a top secret combat bow and an arsenal of devastating arrows, you must traverse and fight your way through a city occupied by a high-tech army, mechs, zombies, and chemical monsters.

Source: The Developer Website.

226134.name: Sumoman
226134.description:
Sumoman is an adventure puzzle platformer with advanced physics, destructible objects and the ability to reverse time. Solve various physical puzzles, trying to keep the unstable Sumoman on his feet in challenging environments.

Source: The Developer Website.

226135.name: Cutthroat Caverns: Death Incarnate
226135.description:
Enter the Realm of the Incarnations. Face the very essence of Anguish, Pride, Hope & Despair. Take up sword against all four Horsemen of the Apocalypse - including Death himself.
If Fortune is by your side, you may just come out alive - and wealthy beyond imagining.
Welcome back to Cutthroat Caverns, the semi-cooperative game of kill-stealing and backstabbing in a deadly dungeon.

Death Incarnate is an expansion dedicated to the most feared Encounters in the game, the Incarnations. Here their numbers are
more than doubled, new Events are themed for their spheres of influence & legendary Relics are imbued with their incredible powers - one for each Incarnation since you first braved the caverns.

Embark on a Quest and see if you are cutthroat enough to
become its very Incarnation.
This expansion set has it all.

15 Encounter cards, 29 Relic cards, 30 Event cards, 22 Fortune cards, 6 Allegiance cards, 3 Quest cards, Tokens

226136.name: Scribble Ships
226136.description:
User Summary

Scribble Ships is a 2D top-down arcade shooter that tosses the player into a world of color and chaos.

226137.name: Beat Cop
videogamehonor: 2017 PAX Curse Award Editor’s Choice Winner
226137.description:
A retro, pixel art style adventure in New York, inspired by ’80s cop shows. You are Jack Kelly and you’ve been framed for murder. Now as a regular beat cop you have to find out, who did that. Expect thick crime story, a lot of black humour and all the other things you can find on the streets of Brooklyn.

Source: The Game Website.

226138.name: On The Road
226138.description:
On the Road – the realistic truck simulator for the PC by the developer Toxtronyx is currently in an advanced stage of development. Use the Early Access phase to tell us about your own wishes and ideas, while being able to explore Germany’s roads already – for a discounted price!

Source: The Publisher Website.

226139.name: Enigma Sphere: Enhanced Edition
226139.description:
Introducing the powered-up Enhanced Edition of Enigma Sphere. This Edition is loaded with new game modes and exciting gameplay experiences that will provide gamer satisfaction. Online multiplayer is available along with a world ranking function to allow you to aim to be the world's best.

Source: The Developer Website.

226140.name: Miniature Garden
226140.description:
Miniature Garden is a Japanese mystery visual novel with multiple endings and art by Korie Riko (Lump of Sugar).

Source: The Publisher Website.

226141.name: Swarm Universe
226141.description:
A highly modifiable top-down shooter featuring highscore-driven singleplayer challenges and online-multiplayer competition. You get arenas, racetracks, mini-games and various online-multiplayer modes. Plus powerful modding-tools to create your own levels and game-modes.

Source: The Game Website.

226142.name: Project:surviving
226142.description:
User Summary

Wild animals and constant hunger with thirst, secrets and a lot of everything is what you will see in the struggle for survival.

226144.name: Downward Spiral: Prologue
226144.description:
Downward Spiral: Prologue is a unique action adventure multiplayer game powered by innovative, free movement in VR without motion sickness.

Source: The Game Website.

226145.name: There's Poop In My Soup: Number 2
226145.description:
After it's viral success in 2016 There's Poop In My Soup is back and better than before. Featuring 3 brand new locations to poop all over, poop on Cowboys and Indians, poop on Pirates, poop on the Undead! Poop anywhere you please!

Source: The Developer Website.

226146.name: The Tower of Madness
226146.description:
Investigate Unspeakable Horrors, Without Losing Your Marbles!
Literally.

The veil between worlds in thinning, an ancient horror is awakening and the very existence of the world hangs in the balance. You must investigate a series of horrific locations and discover the unknownable truth before the world ends – or go mad in the attempt to save it.
Find the paranormal gates that have opened onto our world, be stout of heart and strong of mind – only then will you discover how to seal the gates and save humanity.

A three-dimensional clock tower, standing a foot tall and filled with marbles of four distinct colors, stands before you. Thirty unworldly tentacles push through the tower walls in every direction, in this high-tension, push-your-luck dice game of Lovecraft inspired horror. Fail your investigation dice rolls and you will be forced to draw a tentacle from the tower. Any marbles that fall as a result affect your character immediately, adding to your Discovery total, gaining spells and knowledge man was not meant to have, gaining madness - or dropping one of three DOOM marbles that will summon Cthulhu and end the game.
Investigate every horrific Location in the deck, each with its own unique dice challenge, in order to save the world before your luck runs out. The player with the most Discovery points is declared the Hero and wins the game. Otherwise, the Insane players collectively enjoy a brief moment of victory as Cthulhu rises, destroys the world and eats them last… as their reward.

226147.name: The Wizard of Oz: Beyond the Yellow Brick Road
226147.description:
The Wizard of Oz: Beyond the Yellow Brick Road, known in Japan as RIZ-ZOAWD, is a role-playing video game developed by Japanese developer Media.Vision for the Nintendo DS. The game is an adaptation of L. Frank Baum's 1900 novel The Wonderful Wizard of Oz, using its characters, locations and plot. The game was originally published in Japan by D3 Publisher on December 25, 2008. Xseed Games published the game in North America on September 29, 2009.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Wizard_of_Oz%3A_Beyond_the_Yellow_Brick_Road The Wizard of Oz: Beyond the Yellow Brick Road]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

226148.name: Bleach: Dark Souls
226148.description:
Bleach: Dark Souls, known in Japan as Bleach DS 2nd Kokui Hirameku Requiem (BLEACH DS 2nd 黒衣ひらめく鎮魂歌（レクイエム）?, lit. "Bleach DS 2nd: The Black-clothed Flickering Requiem") is the second Bleach game for the Nintendo DS. The game introduces new characters, and adds new moves for the older characters as well as introducing new game modes. Bleach: Dark Souls also includes Hollows of varying sizes, for players to fight. The number of Reifu cards in-game are also increased from the original, and more cards (four cards, instead of the previous game's two) are displayed on the touch screen during battle. The Wi-Fi battle mode has been improved to make it easier to play online. The game's theme song is "Resistance" by High and Mighty Color.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bleach%3A_Dark_Souls Bleach: Dark Souls]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

226149.name: GUNNVR
226149.description:
User Summary

You are the GUNNVR, controlling a new, upgradable turret on an Earth Defence Force ship.

226150.name: Babylon 2055 Pinball
226150.description:
Enjoy the feeling of pinball through hours of gameplay.

Source: The Developer Website.

226151.name: Quantic Pinball
226151.description:
Enjoy the feeling of pinball through hours of gameplay.

Source: The Developer Website.

226152.name: Pastry Lovers
226152.description:
Pastry Lovers is an adventure simulation game that sets in a fantastic Pastry Kingdom.

Source: The Game Website.

226153.name: The Eagle's Heir
226153.description:
Defend Napoleon's heir in this steampunk alternate history game of political maneuvering, airship adventure, and romantic intrigue! Will you bring liberty to France, or plunge Europe into bloody war?

Source: The Developer Website.

226154.name: A-Escape VR
226154.description:
User Summary

A-Escape is an escape room game built from the ground up for VR. Will you escape in time?

226155.name: Castle Explorer
226155.description:
User Summary

Castle Explorer - The Magical board game for 1 to 8 players. Set in a vibrant fantasy realm where players take on the roles of courageous heroes willing to brave the legendary dangers of the castle.

226156.name: Flamel's miracle
226156.description:
User Summary

Assistant and I headed to a newly discovered Plane world for new resouces. Unfortunately, we ran into worm hole, due to which our spacecraft were forced to make emergency landing onto an unknown world.

226157.name: Frozen: The Ball at Arendelle
226157.description:
Description from the publisher:

Frozen: The Ball at Arendelle is a board game for children based on the popular Disney cartoon Frozen. The game is an interesting and colorful memory trainer — the players have to figure out who didn't come to the ball. Everything happens in a very simple way.

At the beginning players are looking at the 6 chips for five second and trying to remember them. Then chips turn around and shuffled. Only 5 chips are opened after that and players have to say what character on the 6th chip. Guessed player take the snowflake and the winner is the first one who get 10 snowflakes.

226158.name: Asmodeus
226158.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dark Lord of the Nine Hells

Asmodeus is the ruler of the extradimensional realm known as the Nine Hells. His ultimate goal is to capture mortal souls to gain power, especially those of the good and the noble. Asmodeus has tried numerous times to collect the souls of Pendragon and Jupiter, but has failed every time.

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes what you need is a character everyone will recognize, even if they’ve never met her before.

226159.name: The Swarminomicon
226159.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Pitter-Patter of Tiny Feet!

Or the flutter of diminutive wings and the glint of beady eyes, or even the slavering of a hundred miniature mouths, the early warning signs of a swarm nearby are easily overlooked. Often seen as a low-level dungeon annoyance, swarms are a flexible idea supported by rules that can be applied to adventures of any scope or level. All you need as a few extra examples!

Within the Swarminomicon you’ll find:

New Swarms: You want swarms? We offer 40 new swarms, from the CR 2 aquatic electric eel swarm to the land-killing CR 20 pestilence swarm, including undead, glyphs, and swarms of baby abberations.
Swarm Feats: Just because you are a collection of thousands of disparate creatures doesn’t mean you can’t learn a few tricks. From the fireball-dodging Dispersing Evasion to the deadly Swarming Vital Strike, these feats allow a GM to fine-tune a swarm to provide the encounter desired.
Swarm Spells: Whether you want to summon some of the new sets of swarms we present, or turn your swarms into a wall, we give you the spells you need to get the most from your new swarms.




Swarm On!

226160.name: Blackwood Setting Primer
226160.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Blackwood tugs at the borders of the Elder Kingdom. Too many men and women flood the cities, refugees from collapsed frontier villages. In these dark times, some answer the Call of Errantry to take up a wanderer's life on behalf of those in need. Sometimes that means looking out for oneself. Sometimes it means giving all for others.

The Blackwood is Grimm's Tales meets Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon. It's The Witcher series meets Kung Fu Hustle. It's Iron Monkey meets Brotherhood of the Wolf. You are errants, a class of wandering adventurers, who search a landscape of deadly beauty for a way to save the settled folk of the Elder Kingdom from ruin.

The Setting Primer starts off with a brief introduction to the history of the Blackwood. Next is a collection of all the miscellaneous info you need to bring basic adventures in the Blackwood to life. It's a perfect companion to our other products:

226161.name: Lady M's Diamond Caper 8/11
226161.description:
From the introduction:

Woke up here chained to a wall. And no - not in a good way. The bloodstains on the floor and rack of sharply bladed tools didn't inspire me that things were going to be good.

226162.name: Frantic Troublemaker
226162.description:
The Troublemaker Add-On follows the simple principle "The more, the merrier".
36 additional cards expand Frantic to a fresh and much, much more unpredictable experience.

226163.name: Alphadia Genesis
226163.description:
User Summary

Alphadia Genesis is a fantasy RPG where the player sets out to solve a murder case in a nearby city.

226164.name: Access Denied
226164.description:
Access denied is a puzzle game in the world where for storage of personal data are used special device in the form of protected boxes. Imagine yourself in the role of the professional cracker of such devices and test your skills for 36 different levels.

Source: The Developer Website.

226166.name: Breaking Teeth: The Battle of Teruel, December, 1937
226166.description:
“Viva la Muerte!”—Rallying cry of the Nationalist forces during much of the Spanish Civil War.

The Republican cause was in serious jeopardy after a year-and-a-half of bloody fighting. Many felt it would take a miracle to rejuvenate an army that was barely hanging on in Madrid, and reeling from repeated Nationalists blows elsewhere in Spain. As winter settled in, the need for some sort of victory in the field was increasingly necessary as France and the Soviet Union began wavering in their support, and Great Britain stepped up its “blockade” that in reality only helped the Nationalists.

One of the most direct threats to Republican survival was the salient to the south of Madrid. Any further Nationalist gains in that sector could cut-off the capital’s link to the rest of Republican-controlled Spain. With little to lose and much to win, General Enrique Lister’s 11th Division was placed in the vanguard of the Republican counter-attack. Their goal was to take the key defensive position of La Muela de Teruel—Teruel’s Tooth.

Can you do as well or better than your historical counterparts? Learn and enjoy!

Each copy of Breaking Teeth is composed of the following:

• One 11 by 17 inch map with game record-keeping tracks and terrain identification.
• 63 un-mounted, double sided units.
• One set of 12 page rules.

Units represent regiments or brigades (infantry) and battalions (armor). Each turn represents 3 days of time.

226167.description:
With Wendepunkte you can play through a potential life in east Germany (at the time of the German Democratic Republic) and after the German reunification. You experience the pressure of the system, discrepancies in your potential biography and you need to make decisions living with its consequences.
While playing you learn about the political turning point in 1989 which changed the life for millions of people completely.

Wendepunkte is a simple, fast-paced and compelling card game. It's fun and different every time being played and it illustrates a part of German history.

The game takes place over three rounds with three turns each. During a turn, all players choose one card from their hand to play, then handing the remainder to an adjacent player.
After each player has revealed their cards simultaneously, the next turn starts with each player then selecting another card from the deck they were passed.
All cards have different symbols on them which either allow you to play certain other cards or they forbid playing them because you're missing the right symbols on the cards you've already played.

After round two and three, all players sum up the points on their played cards and the player with the most points wins the game.
226167.name: Wendepunkte

226170.description:
There can be only... Wait! There is another...

This new set of Guildhall contains an all new stand-alone set for Guildhall, featuring six never
before seen professions. Additionally, this set contains two mini expansions: "The Chapter
Masters" and "The Master Houses.”

Contents:
120 Profession Cards
6 Profession divider/reference cards
30 Victory Point Cards
Victory Point divider/reference card
30 Chapter Master mini expansion Profession Cards
Chapter Master divider/reference card
3 Master Houses Mini Expansion Cards
Master House divider/reference card
Rulebook
Standard Guildhall Fantasy Box ready for the Box of Holding
226170.name: Guildhall Fantasy: The Gathering

226171.description:
Brushed-metal Munchkin pin, in the shape of Spyke's head.

Special rule: Each Munchkin Pin you are wearing gives you a +1 bonus in combat. After each fight you are in, win or lose, roll a d6. If you roll equal to or less than the number of Munchkin Pins you are currently wearing, remove one pin. You may not wear more than one pin of each color during any game.
226171.name: Munchkin Metal Pin

226174.name: Vikingaspelet
226174.description:
The game is played on a slanted grid using three pieces to a player, representing viking longships; the goal is to cross the playing field to your opponent's starting spaces the fastest. Each turn a die is rolled, with an odd result usually resulting in moving one ship one space, and an even result meaning a lost turn. Opposing ships block but do not capture each other. Some spaces require a specific die result to enter, and other spaces are effectively forbidden, sending a piece back to the start if for some unexplained reason you should enter them.

The game is nominally for 2-4 players, representing the vikings of Sweden, Finland, Norway and Denmark, but it would not be fair to play with 3, since the board is effectively divided in half and with 4 players the two pairs interact very weakly except for the racing aspect.

There is no year of publication, but the Alga logo (or lack of one) suggests the 1940s or 1950s.

226176.description:
Description from the publisher:

In Fallout: Wasteland Warfare, players build their own crew from a wide range of factions, allies, and iconic characters from the Fallout series, then play in apocalyptic games of 3-30 high-quality 32mm scale resin miniatures through a huge variety of iconic scenery and settlement buildings, from the Red Rocket to Sanctuary Hills, Nuka-Cola vending machines and wrecked vehicles. Settlements include buildings, defenses, and resources that impact the crew's army list and abilities in the wasteland.

Fallout: Wasteland Warfare includes an entire narrative campaign arc as well as unique random missions with narrative-style objectives, and crew caps recovered in missions can be used to improve the crew's perks, weapons, gear, and upgrades for the next encounter. In either player vs. player or tournament mode, players try to survive the tabletop wasteland.

The game also comes with a customizable solo-play AI deck to control enemies that play to their strengths and replicate a faction's tactics while attempting a narrative mission or perfecting settlement-building strategy. Players can also team up with a friend to defend a larger settlement or explore narrative missions in cooperative games against AI forces or the post-apocalyptic dangers of the wasteland.
226176.name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare

226178.name: Star Trek: The Fiasco Frontier
226178.description:
User summary:

This bare-bones playset is based on stereotypical tropes extracted from the Star Trek media franchise.

226179.name: Pipe-weed: A Fiasco Playset
226179.description:
From the introduction:

The Shire - the name conjures images of rolling green hills, serene walks through the countryside, and small but diligent hands working the good earth.

But beneath the Shire's veneer of peaceful, good-natured living lies an orgy of pipe-weed, overeating, and reckless pyromania.

226180.name: Fata Capuam
226180.description:
From the introduction:

The House of Cassius has been the spit pool of Capua since the infamous slave rebellion of fifteen years ago. The games and the whole gladiator business has not been the same since.

Last year marked the change in the city's fortune. By the order of Julius Caesar 20000 new citizens moved into the area. Though most of them might have been workers luckily there was enough highclass citizens to lure in a few sponsors.

226181.name: BlackSmith HIT
226181.description:
You cannot dream yourself into a character, you ought to hammer and forge yourself. If you live by the same ideology and aren’t afraid to work hard to get you want, gear up mate!
Brand your name amongst the best blacksmiths in the world.

Source: The Game Website.

226182.name: Trigger Happy Shooting
226182.description:
User Summary

Trigger Happy Shooting is an immersive shooting range experience built to entertain both the casual gamer and marksman alike.

226183.name: Lament
226183.description:
User Summary

Lament, an NES styled Action-Platformer about a wolf with a buster sword!

226184.name: Gemstone Keeper
226184.description:
Gemstone Keeper is a twin stick shooter where avid explorers go down into the Cistershire Caverns, a large, dangerous and mysterious set of caves and caverns that are filled with vast amounts of rare and valuable gemstones.

Source: The Developer Website.

226185.name: Sketch! Run!
226185.description:
User Summary

Once upon a time the scribbles in a copy-book became alive. And Liny became alive together with them.

226186.name: Mr. Donovan
226186.description:
A Single player online battle open world on an alien planet. Defend your ship from nightly raids, encounter odd and intelligent adversaries, befriend and earn the love of pets in this blend of tower defense and battle arena genres.

Source: The Game Website.

226187.name: God and Nemesis: of Ghosts from Dragons
226187.description:
Bizarre lands! Fantasy! Chaos! You start off with the main chapter centered in the bizarre alien land as described in the book Gods and Nemesis: Leviathan Seed. Additional chapters will be added allowing you to advance your character.

Source: The Developer Website.

226188.name: WAVESHAPER
226188.description:
User Summary

Triangle blushed, looking away as sheepishly as she could given that she was a just a primitive vector shape.

226189.name: Symphony of the Machine
226189.description:
An ancient tower stands in a barren land - ascend it and discover its mysterious powers. With the tower’s guardian by your side, conduct the weather to breathe life back into the lands around you. Immerse yourself in the beauty of Symphony of the Machine’s world.

Source: The Developer Website.

226190.name: Dovetail Games Euro Fishing
226190.description:
Euro Fishing immerses you deep into the adrenaline-packed action, fun and beauty of Europe’s most famous lakes. Master your rod, line and tactics, and refine your technique to become a top angler. This is the closest you can get to real fishing from the comfort of your own couch.

Source: The Game Website.

226191.name: Rattus: Spoils of War
226191.description:
Strange things are going on in Europe. People are disappearing and followers are changing faction. The plague appears to be stronger in some countries, but nobody really knows why. At least people are warned and new alliances are made. Let’s bring an end to this plague!

This is an mini-expansion. Rattus (base game) is required to play. For the Tamerlane card is Rattus Africanus (expansion) required to play.

226192.name: Italia 1917-1918: A Farewell to Arms
226192.description:
"Italia 1918 - A Farewell to Arms" is an operational wargame which simulates the fierce fighting which pitted the troops of the Entente (Italy, France, Great- Britain and USA) against those of the Central Powers (Austria-Hungary and Germany) during the period between the Battle of Caporetto (Oct 1917) and the Villa Giusti Armistice (Nov 1918).

Basic rules allow the players to tackle 6 variously sized scenarios, from 1 to 6 hours of play, using either a part of the board, or the map in its entirety. 5 of the scenarios are designed to be played on the ‘zoom’ map, in order to take maximum advantage of the improved play experience provided by the larger hexes.

Advanced rules allow the players to simulate the whole campaign; they introduce the reconstruction of destroyed units, the management of strategic reserves and the use of random events cards (50 for each side) with various effects and evocative titles such as “Rommel”, “Hemingway” or “I ragazzi del 99” (“The boys of 99”), for example.

226193.name: Kickin' Your Caterpillar
226193.description:
This a set collection / take that card game for players of all ages where each player tries to get enough pieces to build their caterpillar all the while, using other cards to prevent their opponents from finishing their caterpillars.

The goal is to build your caterpillar by collecting and playing A Head piece, a Tail piece and four body pieces before the other players.

Components
This game deck is made up of 7 Head cards, 28 Body cards, 7 Tail cards, 20 Red attack cards, and 6 Green defense cards.

To complete your caterpillar you need to have in play in front of you, one Head, four Body segments, and one Tail segment. If you have those six cards in play in front of you, you win.

Other players will try to force you to discard pieces, or even take pieces from you for their own caterpillar.

boardgameimplementation: Kickin' Your Ass!: The Drunk Edition
226194.description:
Kickin’ Your Ass is a set collection / take that card game where you try to build your Ass, while kicking other players’ Asses.
You try to collect each piece of Ass you can get your hands on. Once you have enough Ass to complete your Ass, you win. But along the way, other players are trying to kick your Ass. This of course results in you losing your Ass, or at least some of it.

Each player starts with a hand of four cards.  All cards are drawn from a common deck.  You build your Ass out of 5 cards, Tail, Back Legs, Middle, Front Legs, Head.
All the while, you play cards to Kick someone’s Ass which makes them lose pieces of their Ass. You can try to stop this by playing Get Off My Ass cards.

If you can find your ass with both hands, you can play Kickin' Your Ass!

(from publisher)
226194.name: Kickin' Your Ass!

226195.name: The Slimeling
226195.description:
From publisher blurb:

The slimeling is a class focused in developing the abilities you would expect from a creature of its nature. Slimelings are highly resilient; they can take a great deal of damage on par with a fighter and they are immune to diseases and poisons. Slimelings are also good at squeezing through tight spots, seeing in the dark, storing items inside their bodies, don’t require to sleep or breathe, making them ideal for underground adventuring. Depending on your background choice, you could be a competent defender, dungeon infiltrator, or have a move connecting you with a more civilized past. As you progress in levels you will be able to steal items from creatures as you hit them, stick to them like glue, crawl on walls and ceilings, consume your enemies as delicious treats, hide in plain sight, stalk your enemies from above, and serve as food to your comrades.

This product contains two files:

A 19 page playbook containing over 20 moves, new magic items, and GM section with stats for some ooze monsters and a simple mechanic on how to handle diseases in DW
A two page character sheet for you to record your character's stats, gear, and moves.

226196.name: Creature Feature: Mummy Templates
226196.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each Creature Feature presents acid-covered predator that stalks sewers and other places of refuse. Their touch can dissolve weapons, equipment, and armor; and they can spew forth corrosive slime.

Creature Feature Mummy Templates presents both types of mummy -- guardian and mummy lord -- presented as templates that can be added to most other creature types. Why should all your mummies be the same when they can differ by creature type, race, profession, experience, and the like?

Each mummy template also comes with an example creature build: the half-folk guardian mummy and mummy lord dwarven priest of war, respectively.

226197.name: Flailing Vine
226197.description:
From publisher blurb:

Most plants thrive in open and sunlight. A rare few make their domain in shadow. The Flailing Vine is of that latter sort; a semi-sentient plant that takes root in dark corners and feeds on flesh to grown and sustain itself. While most of its meals are vermin and other creatures that dwell in the dark, a fully grown Flailing Vine is more than capable of killing and devouring larger creatures.

Once every few months, the Flailing Vine releases spores that fill the air around it and coat its surroundings. If a living creature comes into contact with these seed spores, there’s a chance they’ll germinate and grow into a new plant beneath their skin. When it’s large enough, it emerges from the unwitting carrier’s body to find a more permanent home. It’s a less than pleasant experience.

226198.name: Arcanis Bestiary Volume II
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
226198.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Hero’s Greatness can be Measured by his Enemies

The world of Arcanis is filled with valiant heroes thrust into epic battles with world shattering consequences. To challenge them, you’ll need the most heinous and monstrous adversaries to bedevil the people of the Known Lands.

Within this book you’ll find:

Over two dozen creatures and adversaries to test the courage of your Heroes!
A number of Common Adversaries, from Coryani legionnaires to Elder Sorcerers!
New Rules, Monstrous Types, Traits and Flaws!
Rules on creating Trials, such as poison, traps, diseases and more!

226199.name: Wrath of Cons
226199.description:
From publisher blurb:

Set Phasers on Outta Sight!

Hello again, rockstars! This is a special Spirit of 77 adventure is a one-shot adventure taking place at SpiritCon '77, the grooviest science fiction convention in the country! Don’t worry if you’re not familiar with a certain (ahem) science-fiction television show that was canceled in the late 1960’s, which inspired this entire adventure. The real action is all about what happens when the original cast gets back together.

This Very Special Episode includes:

Seven Pre-Generated Characters - Each of these characters is built in the Spirit of 77 system, ready to play.
New Adventure: The Play is Still The Thing - This adventure transports your players to the science fiction convention, SpiritCon! As the former cast of the television show, Space Pioneer, they’ve come back together for a huge announcement that naturally becomes easier said than done.




Live long and be funky. And as always and Keep on Truckin’,

226200.name: Crypt of Bones (DCC)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
226200.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dark and twisted things are crawling up to the surface of the world. Lamotruu, demon lord of graveyards, has been unwittingly released from his prison by a band of heroes, and now the filthy claws of Lamotruu’s most loyal servants dig their way through centuries of rest. The town of Amberdale finds itself in the crosshairs of a full undead uprising spurred on by the demon lord’s return, and the Black Graveyard hungers for fresh life once again.

BF2 Crypt of Bones is a Fantasy Renaissance Adventure Module designed for a group of four to six characters levels 6 or 7. It is a follow-up to BF1 Tower of Skulls, wherein a band of heroes destroyed that unholy site – setting free its master in the process. Characters with a particular hatred of undead and demons are going to find much of both to their dismay in this scenario.

226201.name: Crypt of Bones (5E)
226201.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dark and twisted things are crawling up to the surface of the world. Lamotruu, demon lord of graveyards, has been unwittingly released from his prison by a band of heroes, and now the filthy claws of Lamotruu’s most loyal servants dig their way through centuries of rest. The town of Amberdale finds itself in the crosshairs of a full undead uprising spurred on by the demon lord’s return, and the Black Graveyard hungers for fresh life once again.

BF2 Crypt of Bones is a Fantasy Renaissance Adventure Module designed for a group of four to six characters levels 6 or 7. Characters with a particular hatred of undead and demons are going to find much of both to their dismay in this scenario.

226202.description:
From publisher blurb:

226203.description:

226204.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dark and twisted things are crawling up to the surface of the world. Lamotruu, demon lord of graveyards, has been unwittingly released from his prison by a band of heroes, and now the filthy claws of Lamotruu’s most loyal servants dig their way through centuries of rest. BF2 Crypt of Bones is a Fantasy Renaissance Adventure Module designed for a group of four to six characters levels 6 or 7. It is a follow-up to BF1 Tower of Skulls, wherein a band of heroes destroyed that unholy site – setting free its master in the process. Characters with a particular hatred of undead and demons are going to find much of both to their dismay in this scenario.

226205.name: Crypt of Bones (C&C)
226205.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dark and twisted things are crawling up to the surface of the world. Lamotruu, demon lord of graveyards, has been unwittingly released from his prison by a band of heroes, and now the filthy claws of Lamotruu’s most loyal servants dig their way through centuries of rest. The town of Amberdale finds itself in the crosshairs of a full undead uprising spurred on by the demon lord’s return, and the Black Graveyard hungers for fresh life once again.

BF2 Crypt of Bones is a Fantasy Renaissance Adventure Module designed for a group of four to six characters levels 6 or 7. It is a follow-up to BF1 Tower of Skulls, wherein a band of heroes destroyed that unholy site – setting free its master in the process. Characters with a particular hatred of undead and demons are going to find much of both to their dismay in this scenario.

226206.name: Lethal Party
226206.description:
Drink shots, or get shot? That's a good question!

Welcome to the life-betting party! A bunch of desperadoes have gathered together — not to bet money, but to engage in a more primitive way to reach to the top: a drinking game. In this party, you can either be wasted or get shot. Only the fastest person can leave here alive.

Lethal Party is a speed game for 3-10 players in which you try to be quick and sharp to grab the correct card to fire your bullets at your opponents. Whoever can survive to the end is the sole winner.

226207.name: Mochiju
226207.description:
Show your power as only the mighty can strike! Bring your favorite space monsters along, and fight for the universe!

Mochiju is a quick card game for 3-6 players. Evolving your monsters down the right path or striking your opponents at the right time is the key to victory! Come enjoy the fun of beating your friends!

226208.name: Fly O'Clock
226208.description:
Fly O’Clock is tiny, highly-addictive arcade endless jumper with innovative one-touch mechanics and unique pixel-art graphics.
The faster you play the more you risk and as you know: no risk no fun.
Check how long you will survive on the clock face, avoid the clock hands and jump between 4 points as fast as you can to reach the top of the leaderboards.

Source: The Game Website.

226209.name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Grombrindal and the Black Gobbo
226209.description: Two new star players, Grombrindal, the white dwarf and his arch-nemesis, the Black Gobbo, are taking the pitch in Blood Bowl. Stats and rules for these two new star players are in the May 2017 issue of White Dwarf magazine.

226210.name: Sailor Moon Crystal: Truth or Bluff
226210.description:
Are you telling the truth or bluffing? Keep your opponents guessing as you pass tiles around the table and try not to get caught being too obvious. Watch out for the Dark Kingdom villains, though, because they can mess with your plans. When one player triggers the end of the game they are defeated and the player with the most number of Success Tokens is the winner!

A hilarious party game of deception and misdirection featuring super-deformed caricatures of your favourite Sailor Moon Crystal guardians!

Game Play Details
Players each attempt to avoid running out of Character Tiles and/or filling the conditions on the selected Ending Tile that triggers the end of the game while simultaneously trying to gain the greatest number of Success Token points. The player that triggers the game’s end has been defeated while the player with the greatest number of Success Token points is the winner.

Game Contents
Everything needed to start bluffing is included in one box:
• 96 character tiles featuring heroes from the Sailor Moon Crystal series
• 6 villain tiles featuring the Dark Kingdom villains
• 10 ending tiles to determine when the game is over
• 63 success tokens to track game points
• 8 plastic tile holders with slots for tiles
• 16 privacy shields to keep your tiles secret
• 2 cloth draw bags for the tiles and tokens

226211.name: Risky Rescue
226211.description:
Risky Rescue is a demanding arcade game from creators of Timberman which combines "snake" like mechanics with "fly gently" rules. Will you pass all the levels or will you set the new world record in endless mode?

Get into your helicopter and rescue the people. Fly as fast as you can and as carefully as you can to not crash in the mountains. Avoid wind mills, cranes, planes and balloons! Explore all the beautiful, flat designed worlds, unlock all the choppers and simply have fun with innovative two-touch controls!

Source: The Developer Website.

226212.name: Zootopia: Mafia in the City
226212.description:
The king of the underworld Mr. Big and his gang are intimidate civilians, forcing them to flee the city. The time has come to rein in the carousing bandits.

The game is based on the classical Mafia. Good citizens with the help of police are trying to expose the criminals and the bandits. Each player is doing his duties and reaching goals. Good citizens should find the bandits. Bandits' goal is survive till the end while citizens fighting against each other.

Good choice for a children's party!

226213.name: Cursed Court
226213.description:
The intrigues and scandals of the realm's greater nobility are a subject of fixation, and even obsession, for the entire kingdom. Most especially for the minor nobility, whose fortunes can be elevated — or shattered — by what happens at court.

In Cursed Court, you must consider both public and hidden information, some of the latter shared among different pairs of players, when wagering your limited influence in each season of the year. As the machinations of the nine key nobles are progressively revealed, your fortunes rise and fall. After three years, a winner is crowned.

226215.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Percival Promo Cards
226215.description: A hunt event card and a secret fighting art card that were included with the Percival miniature, which itself is not part of the game. The event card is meant to be shuffled into the standard hunt event cards to give a random chance to trigger the event "Dead Warrior". In this event it is possible to achieve the secret fighting art "Black Guard Style".

226216.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – White Speaker Promo Cards
226216.description:
Two gear cards and a sticker to alter the white speaker event in the rulebook. These were included with the White Speaker miniature, which is not part of the game.

Gear:

Speaker Cult Knife (Weapon, 3/6+/4, two affinities red upside, downside; deadly, sharp; while insane and not wearing armour or accessories, gain +2 evasion, +2 strength)

Bloodskin (Item, two affinities green upside, downside; When you depart you fill the bloodskin and gain two bleeding tokens. At the start of each your acts, remove 1 bleeding token)

226218.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Fade Promo Cards
226218.description:
This White Box Promotional Expansion for Kingdom Death: Monster expands on the hunt phase. It includes a miniature to represent Fade, a Basic Hunt Event Card and two gear cards which can be gained during this hunt. When this card is encountered, the survivors discover Fade's ultimate fate and can choose to brave the dangerous Harvester in order to gain the Sword of Silence, a Newborn child or possibly both.

This expansion has been said to include some interaction(s) with the upcoming Red Witches expansion.

Gear Cards:

Newborn
Carried Item
No Affinities
Traits: Irreplaceable (If the survivor carrying this item dies, it is archived)
Passive Abilities: while you have this, all of your weapons gain slow. When you return to the settlement, archive this and gain +1 population.

Sword of silence
Weapon, Sword
2 Speed/5+ Accuracy/6 Strength
Affinities: Top; Red Half, Left; Blue Half, Right; Green Half
Traits:
Sentient (You must be insane to wield this weapon)
Irreplaceable (If the survivor carrying this item dies, it is archived)
Unique (There may be only one copy of this item in your settlement at a time)

Passive Abilities: Gains sharp if you have 5+ understanding. While your settlement has this sword, ignore events "White secret" and "White Speaker")

226220.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Before The Wall Promo Cards
boardgameversion: White Box Promo - Before the wall
226220.description:
This White Box Promotional Expansion includes a miniature that represents Aya the Survivor wearing Vagabond Armor while wielding a Black Sword (Gormery) and a Beacon Shield (Blacksmith), this can be used to represent a female survivor in game. Also included are two gear cards and an armor set card for complete Vagabond Armor (which is an alternate Leather Armor set).

Crafting Recipes for the gear cards are printed on the back. There is currently no way to craft the White Dragon Gauntlets, but it is speculated that this will change when the Ivory Dragon expansion is released.

In order to complete the Vagabond Armor set you will also need a copy of the 'Beyond the Wall' promotional cards.

Armor Set card: Vagabond Armor
Pieces required to complete the set
Tabard
Leather Chest or Leather Breastplate
White Dragon Gauntlets or Leather Gloves
Leather Skirt
Cloth Leggings or Leather Boots

You cannot wear head armor, but head accessories are allowed.

Full set bonus: 1 Armor to all locations, gain all the benefits of Sword Specialization and Sword Mastery.

Gear Cards:

Tabard
Torso Accessory (1 Armor, body)
Affinities: Left; Blue Half
Passive Ability: When you are encouraged, gain +1 insanity, if your settlement is barbaric or gain +1 survival if your settlement is romantic

Note: The Tabard requires the Cloth Starting Gear card to craft.

White Dragon Gauntlets
Hand Armor (12 Armor points)
Affinities: Red; Left Half

Passive Ability: Requires 3 Red Affinity: When you Sideswipe, gain +1 accuracy and +5 strength for your next attack this turn

It is not known what a Sideswipe in the game is at this stage.

226221.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Twilight Thong
boardgameversion: White Box Promo - Pinup Order Knight
226221.description:
A gear card that was included with the Pinup Order Knight miniature, which is not part of the game.

Twilight Thong (Waist; 0 Armor; It's fabric responds to you: stress causes intense constriction. Do not suffer brain traumas (ignore this if you have destroyed genitals)

226222.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Allison The Twilight Knight Promo Cards
boardgameversion: White Box Promo - Allison the twilight knight
226222.description:
This White Box expansion includes a miniature for Allison the Twilight Knight Miniature (which can be used to represent a female survivor), a sticker to update the Hooded Stranger event from the People of the Lantern (core game campaign). This sticker updates the items given to the settlement by the Hooded Stranger to include the Blue Lantern and the Dormant Twilight Cloak.

The Gear Items are:

Blue lantern
Carried item
No affinities
Traits:
Sentient (User must be insane to use)
Cursed (Once equipped by a survivor it cannot be removed from their grid and is lost when that survivor dies)

Activated Ability:
Suffer 2D10 brain damage and reveal Hit Location cards until you reveal the trap. Put these cards back in the same order. Limit once per showdown.

Dormant Twilight Cloak
Worn Head Accessory (3 Armor points)
Blue Half-Affinity on top slot
Traits:
Unique (Only one copy of this card in a settlement)
Irreplaceable (Lost if the survivor wearing it dies)
Accessory (Can be worn in addition to other head slot items)

Passive Abilities:
Ignore sentient on all gear. You cannot depart with this if you have 3+ understanding

226223.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Prismatic Lantern
boardgameversion: White Box Promo - Pinup warrior of the sun
226223.description:
A gear card that was included with the Pinup Warrior of the Sun miniature (which is not part of the game):

Prismatic Lantern (Item, no affinities; +1 Movement, Irreplaceable, Unique; During the showdown you may archive this and gain 1 permanent affinity of any color.

226224.name: Hot Seat: Even More Expansion
226224.description:
Description from the publisher:

Been through the original game a few times over? Know every question by heart? Freshen up the Hot Seat with all new questions that will keep everyone at game night on their toes.

These cards are similar in nature to the cards included in the original game.
Hot Seat is required to play this expansion.

226225.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Nightmare Breast Pump
boardgameversion: White Box Promo - Pinup wet nurse
226225.description:
Gear card included with the Pinup Wet Nurse miniature, which is not part of the game:

Nightmare breast pump (Item, one blue affinity upside; Sentient, irreplaceable, female-only; The pumps lips mimic a baby's cries, stimulating milk glads. As a returning survivor, gain +1 to your intimacy rolls this settlement phase)

226226.name: Operation Pincher: Stalin’s Drive In the Middle East, 1949
226226.description:
Operation Pincher (OP) is an alternative history wargame, designed by Ty Bomba, which allows two players to investigate the strategic parameters that would’ve been in place in southeastern Europe and the Middle East had Stalin attacked there at that time, most likely in conjunction with a drive into Western Europe. His goal in starting such an operation would’ve been to blitz to the oilfields and Allied base areas in North Africa and the upper Persian Gulf. That would’ve effectively broken the geostrategic back of the British Commonwealth of Nations, disrupted Europe’s oil supply, and delayed the US from being able to mount an atomic bombardment campaign into the USSR.

The scenario is based on the actual “Pincher” series of defensive plans drawn up in the Pentagon from 1946 through 1949.

There are rules for US atomic bombs, but their use is constrained by politics. That is, the late 1940s marked the arrival of the anti-imperialist (“third world” or “nonaligned”) movement on the world stage. So, if the Americans try to win by using enough bombs to blow to bits Stalin’s attacking horde, they do so much damage to the environmental and socio-political ecologies as to undo that victory in the strategic sense.

The extra-large-hex 34x32” map covers from Albania and Thrace south to Benghazi and Kuwait and east to Tehran and the Caspian Sea. Each hexagon represents 60 miles (97 km). Each of the eight full game turns represent two weeks of ‘real time.'

Communist units of maneuver are Soviet and satellite-nation armies (plus super-elite Guards Airborne divisions) along with Allied armies, corps, divisions, brigades, and regiments. There are no US units on-scene at the start of play, but army “regimental combat teams” and Marine Corps regiments and a brigade rush in as reinforcements. Air power is abstracted, with counters and rules showing the effects of one side or the other gaining temporary air superiority over portions of the map.

Since this is a secondary theater (in regard to a presumed main front in Western Europe), the Communist player is never certain exactly what his order of battle will be until set up. He knows, however, it will contain a total of 12 to 14 Soviet combined arms, mechanized, shock and tank armies, along with 10 satellite-nation corps and armies (and possibly three to seven divisions of ultra-elite airborne divisions).

Each match generally runs through three phases. In the first, the Communist juggernaut drives deep across Turkey and into Mesopotamia. Only the Turkish and Israeli Armies, and the use of a-bombs by the US, can slow the advance. As Soviet losses mount and US prestige sinks, the middle stage begins. It’s characterized by both sides maneuvering, seeking to hold or take still-contestable key areas. The Soviet guards airborne force is most likely to make its appearance. A-bombs are still going off, but their targeting has to be ever more selective and there are fewer such attacks. During this period a well executed Soviet campaign will achieve its victory objectives. The end game sees an Allied counteroffensive, as that player throws in everything he’s got to try to take back from the Communists enough victory hexes to overturn what will otherwise be their end-of-play win on points.

226227.name: Hot Seat: NSFW Expansion
226227.description:
Description from the publisher:

Ready to turn up the heat on the Hot Seat? These cards will have you sweating when it's your turn and laughing when it's someone else's. We've held nothing back and neither should you.

Ever wonder what your friends will only do when their drunk? Or what their most disturbing sex dream was about? There’s only one way to find out!
Hot Seat is required to play this expansion.

226228.name: Lady M's Diamond Caper 9/11
226228.description:
From the introduction:

Take the small sealed parcel from Ambrose and place it under the specific orchid, in an arboretum in a specific mansion house. Not the weirdest job I've had but still - a bit unusual.

Mind you, in return Ambrose won't kill me, Franz or any of our friends that he listed - just how did he know about them all? Who is this guy?

226229.name: The Ancient Tomb of Phandalin
226229.description:
From the introduction:

The adventurers are asked to investigate the cause of undead attacking villages at a nearby cemetery. This adventure is meant for players new to the game and introduces two new undead creatures to the game.

A 3-hour adventure for 1st level characters.

226230.name: Sum2Zero
226230.description:
SUM2ZERO is the innovative card game that puts a spin on zero-sum game theory.

Easy to Play
Each player starts with 10 cards. The object of the game is to place 1 to 3 cards, so that your cards plus the base card add to zero. The first player with no cards wins the game.

Red cards are negative numbers from -1 to -12 while black cards are positive numbers from +1 to +12. Action cards – Boom!, Reset, Checked, Imaginary, Thunder, and Cubit - have been added to give it a twist!

What’s in the Box
104 total cards
- 44 positive number (1 to 12) cards
- 44 negative number (-1 to -12) cards
- 3 positive and 3 negative imaginary cards
- 2 Boom!, 2 Reset, 2 Checked, 2 Thunder, and 2 Cubit cards

Examples:

If the base card is positive 7, a player could throw a negative 7 card.
(+7) + (-7) = 0

If the base card is positive 7, a player could throw a negative 1, negative 2, and negative 4 cards.
(+7) + (-1) + (-2) + (-4) = 0

If the base card is positive 7, a player could throw a positive 8, negative 10, and negative 5 cards.
(+7) + (+8) + (-10) + (-5) = 0

If the base card is positive 7, a player could throw a negative imaginary card (choose the card to be -11) and a positive 4.
(+7) + (-i) + (+4)= 0

226231.name: Big Gay Orcs
226231.description:
Designer's summary
In Big Gay Orcs, you'll play big, tough, sensitive and heartbroken orcs trapped in a fortress that's being overrun by your enemies. Will you stay, and sell your lives dearly? Will you find love, here, at the end of everything? Will you run away with a handsome shaman and leave the others to die?
Play, and find out!

226233.name: Chronomega
226233.description:
The year is 2137. The crew and equipment of the Time-Space Research Station, Chronomega One, have been emergency-ejected into outer space. You play one of the surviving scientists who must collect pieces of floating research tech and combine them into Electromagnetic-, Gravity-, and Time-bending tools to help bring Chronomega One back under control. You have no idea which member of the crew is responsible for the emergency protocol lock-down and crew ejection, so you can’t trust any of them!

The player's goal is to collect a full set of the three types of Computer cards (all values 1, 2, 3) to unlock the Station Key Code, and reach the central Computer portal of the station first (and in advanced play, before the station explodes).

The game utilizes a rotating space station board and transparent hexagonal tech cards that represent the four 'suits' of the game, Electromag, Gravity, Chrono, and Computer. The players get three actions each turn to move about the board or play cards. They'll want to collect the floating tech cards during their turn and utilize them for different effects. All the tech cards consist of one of the four suits and are valued 1-3.

If a player encounters another player on the board, they'll utilize their tech cards to engage in a showdown. This consists of each player bidding one of their tech cards. The bids are then revealed and winner determined based on the tech suit played. Certain types of tech defeat others: Electro defeats Grav, Grav defeats Chrono, Chrono defeats Electro. If two types of the same suit are played, higher values defeat lower. All suits defeat Computer, unless their values match (e.g. Grav 3 vs Computer 3), in which case the Computer suit player wins. The winner takes the card that was bid and may push the opposing player 3 spaces (if in outer space), or up or down one level of the space station (including out into an airlock).

All tech cards have a basic function they may be played for as an action, such as move an extra space or to force another player to discard cards. Two transparent tech cards also may be combined and over-layed to activate a catalytic effect, which grants different powers based on the combined card's values and suits. If a full three-part set of tech cards are collected of the same suit (values 1, 2, and 3 of a single suit) they form a POD. These grant the most significant abilities in the game. The more powerful card effects require the player to be standing upon an appropriate research portal to use, either one of the permanent portals within the rotating space station or from a floating portal out in space that they cobbled together from another high-value tech card of the same suit.

The space station itself is surrounded by trapped airlocks which make simply entering the station a risky endeavor. While inside, every time a player ends a turn within the space station their ring level rotates 90 degrees, lining up different portals and pathways with the inter-level Grav chutes. Furthermore, other players may cobble together Electro catalyzers from floating tech cards to try and teleport players into other areas of the station, spend Grav tech to pull cards away from other players, or utilize Chrono tech cards to cause the addition or loss of turns and actions.

Once a player with a full hand of Computer cards reaches the inner Computer Portal of the station, they deactivate Chronomega One’s self-destruct sequence and win the game.

226235.name: FourCuatro
226235.description:
The Gateway to Card Gaming: FourCuatro is a 2-player competitive card game for teens and adults.
You cast spells to defeat your opponent and use defensive traps to counter their spells against you. There are multiple paths to victory.

The game includes complex decision making and layers of thinking, especially if you play the “draft” or “constructed” formats.

To play the basic format, you must shuffle the 66 card deck and pass out 33 to each player. Revealing the bottom card will show who goes first. On your turn, you cast a spell, and your opponent may or may not try to block it with a trap. Spells are placed based on mana energy available to the players. A player loses the game when they must draw a card, but they cannot. The complete instructions (including constructed format instructions) are found in the deck or on the website.

226237.name: RPGQuest: A Jornada do Herói
226237.description:
A Medieval Fantasy Boardgame based on Joseph Campbell´s "Hero´s Jorney" and Hermetic Kabbalah simbolism.

Each Player controls a small group of Adventurers who seek fame and fortune in the Lands of the Sephiroth.

The first part of the game is the setup. 20 Modular Tiles representing the 10 Sephiroth of the Kabbalah and 10 Mythical Places are randomly assembled to form the board.

Then, the Castle of the Emperor and the 4 Reigns (Cups, Swords, Staves and Coins) as well as other places of interest (Labyrinth, Orc Camp, Cemetery, the Ruins, the Elven Tree, the Great Market etc) should be placed on board.

Finally, the 3 Great Nemesis (Mythological Monsters sucha as Hydra, Cerberus, Dragons, etc) should be placed according to instructions.

Each Player starts with a Hero/Heroin and a Call to Adventure. It´s goal is to form the most famous and rich group of Adventurers in the 4 Reigns. Characters can be of any 4 classes (warrior=Earth, Thief=Air, Cleric=Water and Mage=Fire), based on the 4 elements of Alchemy, or combinations of that classes. The game is a sandbox, so there are many types of actions that can be played at every turn: They can search for missions, rumours, adventures, slay wandering monsters, quest for artifacts, craft magical itens, upgrade their characters, travel through the Reigns, explore dungeons and other actions.

As the game progresses, the group will meet friends, acquire new artifacts, meet some of the 22 Major Arcana of the Tarot and become more powerful, so they can face their Ultimate Nemesis.

The game is based on Victory Points, so it can vary from 30 minutes to a whole afternoon or even more, if you choose the Campaing Mode.

226238.name: Grandfather Tree
226238.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 350th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a cult site centered upon an ancient tree.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

226239.name: Ship Files: Atticus Class Freelancer
226239.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book details the Atticus Class Freelancer. A fast and able small ship, it is able to fulfil a multitude of roles. Ideal for just about any setting and a small group of adventurers.

Contains:

Description and Technical Information.
2 versions, the standard and the non jump (NJ) variant.
Deckplans for both vessels.
Colour plates of 5 example craft.
Game stats and play sheets
Example Crew
Air/Raft stats using the new CE Design System

226240.name: Empath
226240.description:
From publisher blurb:

With the Psionics Augmented: Occult project, Dreamscarred Press is working to integrate psychic magic from Pathfinder RPG: Occult Adventures into the psionics system from Ultimate Psionics and related products. Within the pages of these releases you'll find new feats, archetypes, items, and more, bringing psionic takes on psychic classes, psychic takes on psionic classes, and everything in-between. With Psionics Augmented: Empath, the psionic take of the medium class is presented with the empath archetype.

The empath is a psionic manifester sensitive to the echoes of history. They can communicate with the personifications of awe-inspiring events, the zeitgeists, and bargain for their power. The empath's contracts with the zeitgeists let her take on their associated powers—and compulsions and goals—that she can mix and match every day.

If you want to play a character who can reach out and connect with the world around them, tug on the heartstrings of all the world, and choose exactly which histories your foes are doomed to repeat, the empath is for you!

In the pages of this product, you will find:

The empath, an archetype for the medium class from Pathfinder RPG: Occult Adventures.
25 Zeitgeists for your empath to use, from the Cogito lesser zeitgeist, to the Vinum Verum supreme zeitgeist.
Variant rules including options for transparency, rune magic, and integration with the Pathfinder RPG: Ultimate Intrigue zeitgeist binder archetype
Rules for how the empath works with the collective
And new psionic powers for the empath

226242.name: Alpha Arkana
226242.description:
From the introduction:

No one knows what existed in the beginning. All that is known is that what is now called the Alpha Arkana was the first spell. It was the spell of creation. It was what created the universe.

In the moments after the casting of the Alpha Arkana, the newborn universe was awash with magical energy. In these first moments of existence, the beings now called gods became. They were not born. One moment there was nothing but magical, chaotic energy. The next moment these beings existed. It is said that they numbered more than the stars in the sky or more than the grains of sand in a thousand beaches.

226243.name: The Hybrid
226243.description:
From the introduction:

Your character has a destiny – no matter how you play it – and that is to become a hero or die in the attempt. Heroes are people and so there are many types, indeed some never even think of themselves as heroes but as peasants or traders. Destiny however makes the changes.

226244.name: The Dune Sea
226244.description:
From the introduction:

Deep in the Anauroch Desert a mysterious town suddenly appears, and the factions of Faerun want to know what mysteries it contains.

Venture into Jupitus, the lost city of the Anauroch, and learn what circumstances warrant its sudden appearance.

A four-hour adventure for 1st-4th level characters.

User summary:

This scenario is distributed as a PDF file and two associated PNG files - a map and a graphic cover.

226245.name: Axiom Null: I AM ZOMBIE RPG Instruction Manual
226245.description:
From publisher blurb:

NOTE: Contains the I AM ZOMBIE prologue and full deck of 54 human print and play ID cards.

PRACTICAL PLAY
THE AXIOM WAY

The Axiom System revolves around simple and elegant rules. Much like a modern board game, its complexities are front-loaded and not piled on at the back end with exceptions, mini-systems, and charts. While the dice-rolling conventions are more involved than in most RPGs, once you know them, everything else just... FLOWS.

In Axiom, dice are not just a way to determine whether you succeed or fail: they work like a series of BETS where a number of factors play into every roll. Will you gain Brainz or Chaw? Will you beat the Hazard number and avoid hurting yourself or a friend? Do you reroll those low numbers, or do you play it safe? Will you use a Twist to skew the odds? All of this makes each and every roll (and reroll) a compelling tactical decision.

The core advantage of the system is that players have many different goals in mind, and thus many ways to both achieve and measure success. It’s not about simply making a roll; every roll is a series of decisions that can potentially change everything down the line. Axiom is dynamic and versatile.

Like A Swiss Watch:
A Finely Tuned Precision Instrument

Axiom also warps what a turn is so that the story unfolds organically and ensures that no one gets bored. By deconstructing the turn, we created a unique initiative and pacing system. You start your turn by taking an action and making a roll, and then on each of your rerolls—which are made on another player’s turn—you pile on details. You can “spend” successes (boosts) as Descriptors to add to the story. The drama of the scene builds step-by-step over each turn, and waiting to see what happens ratchets up the tension.

You can make a character in minutes (“Just pick five cards”), but each persona is interesting and compelling. More than the ultimate pick-up game, I Am Zombie is also a great arena in which to experiment and play. Just pick and choose which Axioms to use!

This fluid and responsive storytelling system is as smooth & elegant as the cards themselves. Indeed, a novice Narrator doesn’t need to know much about how the system works as the rules and the players work together to run things themselves. Thus, the only thing the Narrator really needs to worry about is... THE STORY.

226246.name: Of No Small Power
226246.description:
Author's blurb:

An inept wizard has used size-manipulation magic to enslave a race of tiny humanoids. The PCs must enter his diminutive realm to defeat him.

226247.name: Toxic Highway #1: The Kill Zone
226247.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need some help devising a story for this new, groundbreaking setting, or just want one that conveys the whole Toxploitation vibe in all its grotesque glory?

Experience your first session of I AM ZOMBIE with “The Kill Zone” and explore the secrets of a paranoid, small town in Texas!

226248.name: Kyr'shin Unchained
226248.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not every GM has time to build the perfect NPC, and not every player knows precisely where to look to build their ideal character concept. Fortunately, Everyman Iconics has your back! In each installment of Everyman Iconics, we present one of the recurring characters illustrated throughout multiple Everyman Gaming products and all the information needed to play the character, including stat blocks for GMs and easy to reference pregen sheets for players. Within, you’ll find the following:

Kyr’shin Yilenzo, Everyman Gaming’s iconic Fighter. Uses rules from Everyman Gaming’s hit product, Everyman Unchained: Fighters.
Includes a detailed character gazetteer featuring Kyr’shin’s vital statistics and character history.
A full, easy-to-reference 20-level character build for Kyr’shin including full class, archetype, feat, and option references. As presented, Kyr’shin is an unchained fighter without any archetypes or mutliclassing.
Seven stat blocks designed to allow GMs to use Kyr’shin as an NPC in their campaigns at CR 1/2, CR 3, CR 6, CR 9, CR 12, CR 16, and CR 19.
Three regenerated character sheets that allow GMs to hand Kyr’shin to a player as a 1st-, 4th-, or 7th-level character for quick playing.

226249.name: Pathfinder Live Action Role Playing: 2015 Manual
226249.description:
From the introduction:

You may have played a tabletop Role Playing game, seen a fantasy film such as the Lord of the Rings trilogy or read a fantasy novel and imagined yourself in the place of one of the characters. How would you react in the same situation? With Live Action Role Play you get the chance to find out.

The aim of the game is to complete a quest that may involve physical combat (in a safe environment), solving puzzles and talking to other inhabitants of the fantasy world. You will create a character with skills and powers you want to use. The physical limits of your character are your own rather than the dice rolls of tabletop games.

User summary:

N.B. This game is unrelated to Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

226250.name: The Clockwork Usurper
226250.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Ponynder Campaign for a group of seventh level adventurers with all party sizes from three to seven supported. This module contains enough material for a good number of normal length adventuring sessions and will allow your players to gain two levels as they play through it.

The Clockwork Usurper continues from where events in The Bloodied Hooves left off and playing the previous modules will enhance your enjoyment of this one. With the Clockwork army and his allies in the Arcys Baronies invading from the west Taralos is under siege once more. Our heroes will need to defend the kingdom, hinder their enemies, travel to allies to nd information, and nally face the Clockwork Usurper himself.

226251.name: Monster Circus
226251.description:
From publisher blurb:

Within this Letter, we take a trip to Argent & Midnight’s Circus Esoterica and Extravaganza of the Strange, known by most as the Monster Circus!

For those of you brave or foolish enough to step within the carnival, you will find...

A Menagerie with monsters such as Flintbeak the cockatrice and Rusty the rust removal monster and more!
A House of Oddities filled with frightening idols, preserved remains of humanoids and beasts, and other weird relics!
And of course the stars of the Big Top! You'll meet Mister Smiley, the goblin ringmaster! A hydra choir! Twin choker acrobats! The fortune-telling Living Tapestry! Kursha the Tamer! And Guk the Troll!




As you might have imagined, being a circus run by monsters, there is some drama within its tents! We have provided a couple scenarios for GMs to run for players interested in helping Smiley run things smoothly! (We won't spoil anything here!)

Finally, for GMs interested in spicing up dialogue with the NPCs found within, we've included a Glossary of Circus Terms!

226253.name: Wasted Youth
226253.description:
Wasted Youth is a satirical look at the things we obsessed over when we were young, possibly still do for some of us. Have you ever gotten so caught up in collecting comic books that your forgot they are supposed to be read. Have you ever bought a toy but never touched it once because it has to stay mint on card. Then Wasted Youth is about you.

Wasted youth is a simple collection mechanic. Each player tries arrange collections and empty their hand first. The twist are the event cards. Event cards let you steal other players scored collections, set them back to square one or just twist them up in general.

226254.description:
In The Ruhr: A Story of Coal Trade, the second game of Thomas Spitzer's historic coal trilogy, you are transported to the Ruhr region in the 18th century, at the beginning of the industrial revolution. Coal, after being discovered in Haspelknecht, is in high demand as cities and factories throughout the region are in need of this coveted resource. The Ruhr river presented a convenient route of transportation from the coal mines. However, the Ruhr was filled with obstacles and large dams, making it incredibly difficult to navigate. Trade coal for valuable upgrades and plan your route to victory along the Ruhr!

In more detail, the players transport and sell coal to cities and factories along the Ruhr river in the 18th and 19th centuries. By selling coal to cities and factories, players acquire unique progress markers. In the beginning, players have access only to low value coal. By selling coal to certain locations, players gain access to high value coal. In addition to selling coal, the players build warehouses, build locks, and export coal to neighboring countries in the pursuit of the most victory points.

This game, an updated version of Ruhrschifffahrt 1769-1890, includes the standalone expansion The Ohio: 1811-1861. In this game, players transport and trade goods along the Ohio River during a time when Ohio was granted statehood and became heavily populated as its industries flourished. The Ohio is played in a manner similar to The Ruhr, but with new and additional elements.
226254.name: The Ruhr: A Story of Coal Trade

226255.description:
1920 Wall Street is a card game for 2 to 4 players.

Each player will tries to collect shares from 4 different companies (corn, cotton, iron and petrol), sell them if they need money and influenciate the value of the different companies in the stock market.
They earn points for making the market fluctuate and for the shares they collect (if they reach the minimum quantity of each kind!).

Everything with the background of the Wall Street Bombing that occured in 1920 at the Financial District, in Manhattan, that will trigger the end of the game and make some changes on the way it is scored.
These changes are affected by the way players discard their cards during the game.
226255.name: 1920 Wall Street

226256.name: Password Express
226256.description:
You and your friends have found an old computer in the attic with lots of clues and notes. Will you be able to decipher all the passwords that protect it before the time runs out?

In Password Express the players divide to form 2 teams. Each round you play with 4 subjects with 1 specific letter each in frenetic turns of 15 seconds.

The teams try to find words that matches the correct subjects and have certain letters in a specific position. They can place tokens on the position cards as many as they can within the 15 seconds of the turn and then the other team will take their chance until no cards are free or both teams pass without placing any token.

At the end of four rounds, the team with the most points is the winner!

226257.name: Devil's Night
226257.description:
From the introduction:

Devil's Night takes place in Detroit, Michigan around the night of October 30th when delinquents go on a spree of arson and vandalism. This year the acts of criminal mischief will reach an all-time high, as roaming beer and drug fueled mobs set hundreds of homes and businesses ablaze. Most of the city's police are on strike and residents will barricade themselves in their homes. And this is when the undead choose to attack.

User summary:

While the cover is Digest size, the remainder of the document is A4 size.

226258.name: A Fairy Tale Fiasco
226258.description:
From the introduction:

So, the fair princess is locked in a tower, the evil vizier has his hooks fully into the king, the mysterious witch keeps turning people into animals, the highway banditry in the woods is worse than ever, and of course love is on the line. Everyone wants their fairy tale ending, but as we all know, not everyone gets a happily ever after. And when they do, is that really what they wanted in the first place?

226259.name: Fiasco in Spaaace!
226259.description:
From the introduction:

Movie Night: Babylon 5 (TV), Star Trek (Any TV/Movie), Star Wars (Any of the good ones), Galaxy Quest, Stargate (TV), Firefly

User summary:

This is a bare-bones playset.

226260.name: MechWarrior (1993)
226260.description:
The SNES game was based upon the original PC MechWarrior, with updated graphics that utilized Mode 7 for the Battlemech mission sequences instead of the PC version's flat-shaded 3D graphics.

The main character is a MechWarrior named Herras whose family was killed by a group of military rogues called "The Dark Wing Lance." Playing as Herras, the player battles many enemies, trying to seek out the leader of the rogues, while relying on intel from a host of contacts and allies at a bar on a nearby planet in the system. In the end, the player's objective is to hunt down and kill the members of the Dark Wing Lance and avenge the deaths of Herras' family.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MechWarrior_%281993_video_game%29 MechWarrior (1993 video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

226261.name: Fiasco on the Disoriented Express!
226261.description:
From the introduction:

It’s the 1930’s and war is nigh in Europe with Herr Hitler as Chancellor of Germany! But still, you can travel across Europe and the Orient in style on board the Orient Express.
