While other teams are preparing for the match by bribing referees, the Bright Crusaders are performing charity matches – a fact that will stop them winning a major tournament until they shape up and learn to play dirty!

Should you be feeling a little less killtacular than most Blood Bowl coaches, and just want to play for the love of the game, this is the Human team for you! You’ll receive 12 plastic Human Blood Bowl players – 2 Throwers, 2 Catchers, 2 Blitzers and 6 Linesmen – with a set of resin head and torso parts used to upgrade them to the Bright Crusaders. The kit includes the options for 2 helmetless Linesmen, a helmetless Blitzer and a helmetless Thrower, as well as a pair of Bright Crusaders coins and 2 turn markers. Sadly, the kit does not include a participation medal…

This 72-component kit comes as 40 plastic and 32 resin parts supplied with 12 32mm Blood Bowl bases and the Bright Crusaders team roster.

226389.name: Classic Dungeon Design Guide Book III
226389.description:
From publisher blurb:

Enchanted fountains shadowed by gargoyle sentries,
Tricksy nymphs cavorting in crystal pools,
Unholy altars, sacred shrines,
Undiscovered treasure vaults,
Thousands upon thousands of wondrous rooms
Filled with treasure, tricks, magic and eldritch horror,
All awaiting your heroes’ intrepid discovery …
What greater mysteries await far below,
For only the most dauntless magi
And fearless warlords to ever find?

Continuing the proud tradition of the CLASSIC DUNGEON DESIGN GUIDE series, Book 3: The Labyrinth Lexicon provides you with a nearly endless array of dungeon room types which you can use to build any size, plan and theme of dungeon you desire. This is the largest and most extensive dictionary of dungeon rooms in existence, with over 1,200 unique entries and 6 matrixed D1000 generation tables. The matrix tables allow to build thematic dungeons with ease, just using room size consideration, floor planning, and random die rolls. When coupled with Book 2: Dungeon Mastery Design Tables, you have everything you need to create instant rooms with instant contents.

In this massive tome you will also find real world examples of floor plans and room arrangements for caves, dungeons, manor houses, strongholds, temples, and tombs; and detailed examples of random room arrangements with thematic sub-clusters (such as strongholds, arenas, hideouts, haunted temples and more).

So what are you waiting for? This book is the perfect companion for THE CLASSIC DUNGEON DESIGN GUIDE, and has been specially designed to serve both as a learning grimoire and as a tabletop go-to book for design and for sandbox play. After all, if you’re going to dare to delve into the netherworld, you should probably take not just a lantern and an elvish sword of great antiquity; you should also carry the ultimate guidebook with you along the way …

226390.name: Bibel-Quizzionär
226390.description: Its a game about the bible. There are a lot of questions from the New and the old Testament. Who is the first on the aim?

226391.name: Realms Of Destiny
226391.description:
Realms Of Destiny is a fantasy adventure board game for 1 to 8 players. Realms Of Destiny can be played head-to-head, cooperatively, solo, or teams.

Players choose their Character, Allegiance, and starting Guild, then explore the board using equipment, treasure, and spells to wander the map, complete quests, capture bounties, meet both allies and foes on the road, build a traveling party, and earn Destiny to claim Blessings and fight whichever Tyrant is harrowing the land for that game session. Even in coop mode, players each have their own adventures, while trading to aid one another, then come together for the final boss battle.

226392.name: 50 Overs Cricket
226392.description:
Board game that simulates limited over cricket.

It can be played by any even number of players (teams), but is ideally suited to two players. Each player bats and bowls for one innings (50 overs).

Once play order is established the bowler determines the type of bowler for the next over by a dice roll. They then place their fielders on the board in setting that matches this type of bowler. Then outcome (and runs scored) of each delivery is determined by drawing a card from a deck of cards. Each card has six possible outcomes, however the outcome is determined by the bowler type (fixed for this over) and therefor is typical to a batsmen playing a delivery from that type of bowler. A well placed field by the bowler should ensure lower scores from the batting team.

Each over consists of four deliveries, so each innings is therefore 200 balls.

The game can be played with or without a scoresheet as a simple magnetic scoring grid (with markers) is printed on the game board.

The winner is the player who amasses the most runs.

From the rules booklet "To play a Board game of cricket in the true spirit of the cricketing tradition. To foster a deeper interest and understanding of the tactical skill required in the National summer sport."

Manufactured & Published locally in NZ by F.T. Connor (Blenheim)

Contents

1 Game Board
100 Cards
9 Fielding Tokens
1 Standard Die
1 Rulebook
1 Pad of score sheets
3 Scoring tokens

226395.name: Trouble in Waterdeep
226395.description:
From the introduction:

The Copper District is warren of poor slums and crumbling old foundries in the Southern Ward of Waterdeep. Lacking the abundant wealth of the Trade Ward to the north and the bustling commerce of the Dock Ward to the West, the Copper District lies in a state of neglected disrepair.

User summary:

For 1st - 3rd level characters.

226396.name: North of Neverwinter
226396.description:
From the introduction:

In a high backed, heavily carved wooden chair, sits a mighty looking dwarf with a thick grey beard. “Greetings, bold travellers. I have need of hearty explorers, firm of arm and mind. Though I am a king, I have no hall under the mountain to call my home. My father and my father’s fathers have been forced to wander the land, with only a crown but not a carved stone beneath our feet. The time has come for my people to reclaim their ancestral home. Aid me in this quest, and I will reward you with riches the likes of which you have never dreamed.”

User summary:

For 1st - 3rd level characters.

226397.name: Cake & Grief Counseling
226397.description:
From the introduction:

As an Aperture employee, you are privileged to work among the best and brightest minds in the world, pushing the envelope of human knowledge further every day, a brave explorer charting unknown territory. However, sometimes the job isn’t all it’s cracked up to be. When Science grows too demanding, when the company’s moral compass starts spinning like a zoetrope, when the years turn to decades and all hope runs out, it drives Aperture’s truest believers to do stupid, vile, greedy, unforgivable things - for themselves, for the company, for Science! What happens when you mix horrendously unethical experiments, reality-bending technology, robots, extra-dimensional invasions and a smattering of desperate, deeply flawed characters?

226398.name: The Burning Ice
226398.description:
From the introduction:

On a continent of long summers and longer winters, where nobles battle both with blade and subterfuge for control of the throne, those who dare with cunning, bravery, or foolhardiness may yet taste victory... before it turns to ashes in their mouth.

226399.name: Blood in the Water
226399.description:
There's sharks in these waters, on this ship, in this town, your neighbors and friends... even your family.

From the introduction:

You're the people of a small harbor town which is home to a beacon of high seas gambling, an odd North Korean import, and more dirty deals than you might realize are right under your nose. There's money to be won, wares to be peddled, deals to be made, and lives to be lost. What's Lady Luck got in store?

226401.name: The Stormlord (Issue 1 - Nov 1979)
226401.description:
From the Contents page:

Editorial - Andreas Sarker & Stephen Chapman
New Monsters - Ian Groves, Andreas Sarker, Stephen Chapman
New Magical Items - Andrew Smith, Donald Taylor
Role Playing in RP Games - Andreas Sarker
Role Playing for Chaotics - Stephen Chapman
Storm Lord (character class) - Andreas Sarker
Tests of the Vokassas (D&D scenario) Andreas Sarker
Feedback
Classified Advertisements
Monster Reply Service

Magazine was side stapled.

226402.name: Blade Runner
226402.description:
From the introduction:

At the start of the 21st century, the powerful Tyrell Corporation designed the Nexus 6 to be virtually identical to a human but superior in strength, agility, and intelligence. This was called a Replicant. They were sent as slaves into the colonies, on risky exploration and colonization of other
planets.

After a bloody rebellion by a group of Nexus 6 in a space colony, the Replicants were declared outlaws on the earth, under penalty of death. Special police brigades, the Blade Runners, have orders to eliminate all who have not complied with the ban.

226403.name: Black Neon
226403.description:
From the introduction:

Live your dreams. That’s what they told us when we were kids. You can do anything you want, just believe in yourself and work hard. They told us that one too. Look at me. Do I look like I’m dreaming? Sometimes the furthest you can dream is surviving the night, hoping to wake up to see tomorrow. If you’re lucky, really lucky, you get your shot. At getting big, getting even, or getting out. You got to take your shot if you see it. And hope, don’t dream, that it all works out.

226404.name: The Big Bang Theory
226404.description:
From the introduction:

In this scenario you are all privileged geniuses who share an apartment in Pasadena (Los Angeles) and common interests, like superhero comics, science fiction series and video games.

While you are renowned scientists, and are able to calculate the probability of the existence of parallel universes, you have no idea how to relate to the world, and especially with girls.

The arrival of Penny, a neighbor that has moved into the apartment across the hall from you, has changed your peaceful and quiet life. Soon, your sentimental and obsessive-compulsive disorders, surface. Every time you see her, you show that you are unable to issue a single coherent or articulated sound and in her presence. It is your crush.

226405.name: California Confederates
226405.description:
From the introduction:

It’s War!

But not here. Yet.

Back East, the Civil War is in full swing, and the blood has already flowed freely on such fields as Manassas, Shiloh, and Fredericksburg. California has declared for the Union, but not all Californians are happy about it. Many of these so-called Copperheads keep their mouths shut and go about their business; others restrict themselves to arguing with acquaintances or publishing inflammatory broadsheets.

But a brave or desperate few look for more active ways to support the South. Perhaps the flow of gold and silver to Federal coffers can be diverted to the Confederacy; perhaps a loud blow for the South in California will raise morale back East and bring glory and opportunity to those who strike it. Or perhaps, just perhaps, sympathy for the Rebels can be harnessed into something much bigger, and a hefty chunk of California might be broken off for the Confederacy.

226406.name: City of Angles
226406.description:
From the introduction:

It's home to millions of lost souls. It's a twisted reflection of an urban nightmare. It's a strange echo of everything we know and love. It's the City of Angles, and if there's a profitable angle to be found here, you're gonna find it...

226407.description: Expands Heroes of Land, Air & Sea to support 5 and 6 players. Features a game board extension, components for the 5th and 6th player and 4 additional factions: the Undead, the Lionkin, the Lizardfolk and the Goblins.
226407.name: Heroes of Land, Air & Sea: Order And Chaos Expansion

226408.name: Sunship: A Game of Celestial Creation and Conquest
226408.description:
Description from the publisher:

Sunship is a game designed for 2-4 players. The board is divided into 8 orbits and an impenetrable asteroid belt. The orbits are further divided into regions of varying economic and strategic value. Additionally, there are 5 transit hubs which facilitate jumping between orbits. The object of the game is to eliminate the other players through conquest or, alternatively, to successfully monopolize all transit hubs for an economic victory.

Holding regions of space are the source of income in the game. The value of regions can be increased by constructing and upgrading space stations. To protect valuable regions, force fields may be constructed. Isolating regions behind force fields, however, diminishes their economic output. A player must, therefore, strike a careful balance between security and trade.

Players may attack adjacent regions with their fleets of space ships. There are three types of space ships in Sunship. Combat is played out on special cards on which the placement of space ships is significant. Depending on the type of ship, the player may select difficult to hit positions, cloak their attack, or attack from the rear. The combat system is elegant, versatile, and based on basic bit math.

226409.name: Life and Death in Oturak
226409.description:
From the introduction:

Hired to guard a traveling merchant caravan, saved by travelers after collapsing in the desert, sent to investigate reports that a wanted and dangerous summoner has been seen in the city...

226410.name: Wisdomantics
226410.description:
From the box
"Wisdomantics - Where Wisdom is Power is an interactive DVD board game for players of various faiths who desire to gain the vast wisdom of King Solomon. Wisdomantics utilizes the proverbs of Solomon to and blends chance, knowledge and strategy to create a fun experience while you learn."

Wisdomantics is a Biblical trivia game with track movement and set collection. Players attempt to complete Solomon's Temple by answering trivia questions about the proverbs of Solomon (included on a DVD) and then choosing a card that allows them to move around a track. As they move, they collect building materials (Gold, Cedar and Cypress) that they use to complete Solomon's Temple on their player board. Players also collect blessing cards. Blessing cards or building materials may be trades 3-for-1 for other resources. The first player to complete his or her temple wins.

226411.name: Jetta D-1: World Travel Game
226411.description:
Jetta D-1 World Travel Game is designed to teach geography.
"Jetta" is a contraction of JET Travel Adventure. In this game, each player chooses a travel itinerary that will take them around the world in a series of flights and places their airplane pawn on the world map board. They then roll two dice repeatedly and add the totals until they reach the exact total required to move their pawn to the next city in their itinerary. They record how many rolls it took. The rules do not specify what to do if the roll total goes over the exact amount needed. When each player has completed his or her itinerary, the player who rolled the dice the fewest times wins. Players will learn the names and locations of cities as well as airport codes.

226412.name: Darkshire Woods
226412.description:
From the introduction:

From the royal court to the commoners in the village, Darkshire Woods is a dangerous place.

226413.name: Daikaiju!
226413.description:
From the introduction:

They are primeval forces of nature, both Terran and alien, walking out of the sea, the earth or the sky to wreak havoc on humanity - DAIKAIJU! (Literally, giant monsters.) Awakened by atomic tests or unscrupulous geniuses meddling with what they shouldn’t, they cause wanton destruction and fight each other, often with strangely familiar wrestling moves - DAIKAIJU! Tremble in fear! Or better yet, run. Or perhaps... fight back? Err... DAIKAIJU!

226414.name: Class Reanimation
226414.description:
From the introduction:

“Oh my God, Kelly, you look exactly the same! I can't believe how long it's been, but you're just gorgeous. Me? I'm married. He's a werewolf.”

Ten years ago, we were awkward and pimpled, or gorgeous and popular, or angry and rebellious -- but we were all monsters. Now, we're pushing thirty, and it's time to gather once more. The monsters of Alucard High School are going to a reunion. We've all changed, some for the better, and others, not so much. Amid howling wolves, punch bowls full of Type AB, and receding hairlines, we try to figure out what happened to our youth.

226415.name: Space Travel Game
226415.description: Space Travel Game was a Jack in the Box kids' meal giveaway. It is a simple spin-and-move game packaged in a small plastic clamshell box. The top of the box is a spinner. Inside is a folded game board with a track leading a space shuttle back to Earth. Players spin and move their pieces either forward or backward on the track (or lose a turn) as indicated, trying to be the first to reach Earth. A note on game design: The spinner is exactly balanced between moving forward and moving backward, and with 40 spaces on the board, this could be a very long game.

226416.name: Children Homes
226416.description:
From the introduction:

Chronically overcrowded and underfunded, Russia’s orphanages are places of shelter for children whose parents are dead, incarcerated, or otherwise unable or unwilling to care for them. Some of them were victims of horrific crimes, forced into drug addiction, prostitution, pornography. Some of them will be victimized after they arrive. All of them are desperate. If they’re there long enough, they age out, unprepared for adulthood.

There’s never enough food, clothing, privacy, space, in the Children Homes.

226417.name: Kabigon's Oyamsumi Yurayura Hammock
226417.description: Players take turns stacking Pikachus on top of a sleeping Snorlax. The game ends when they all come tumbling down off the hammock and the player that caused the tumble loses.

226418.name: Четвёртый день
226418.description:
From the introduction:

Death came from nowhere. As always, she took everyone by surprise. Several people were quick enough to barricade themselves in the supermarket and start looking for ways to survive. You are the leaders of this group, and its future is not particularly rosy. You are probably the only survivors. Your new home is already beginning to deplete its supplies, and behind the glass are a lot of monsters, hungry for the flesh and perhaps your souls.

So, today is the fourth day of the end of the world.

226419.name: Crimson Hills
226419.description:
User Summary

Set in the haunted lands of castle Baskerville, Crimson Hills puts you in the shoes of a brave detective solving puzzles, evading lurking horrors, and uncovering Lovecraftian mysteries in this first person adventure.

226420.name: Elyra: Echoes from the Void
226420.description:
Explorer Aida Nebul finds herself stranded on a distant moon in Elyra, a sci-fi metroidvania that follows your quest to explore the alien world and fight against the hostile faction hunting you across the moon.

Source: The Developer Website.

226421.name: Exo One
226421.description:
Exo One lets you slide, roll, and fly across atmospheric planets as a high-tech drone, using momentum to ramp off dunes and glide through ruins. As you explore different exoplanets, you uncover the story of a doomed expedition.

Source: The Developer Website.

226422.name: Double Down
226422.description:
From the introduction:

Set on on the Eastern seaboard of America, this playset features the big casinos and sports betting shops of Atlantic City, and the punters - some desperate, some foolish, some lucky - who are drawn there like moths to a flame.

226423.description:
Description from the publisher:

This is the more drunker edition of the ass grabbin’ Kickin’ Your Ass card game. It is a card game where you try to build your Ass, while kicking other players’ Asses and where getting your Ass kicked means shots!

You try to collect each piece of Ass you can get your hands on. Once you have enough Ass to complete your Ass, you win. But along the way, other players are trying to kick your Ass and force you to drink!. This of course results in you losing your Ass, or at least some of it.

Each player starts with a hand of four cards. All cards are drawn from a common deck. You build your Ass out of 5 cards, Tail, Back Legs, Middle, Front Legs, Head.

All the while, you play cards to Kick someone’s Ass which makes them lose pieces of their Ass and drink so it get’s better the more ass you kick.

There are also defensive cards such as Kiss My Ass that will prevent this and force the kicker to drink.
226423.name: Kickin' Your Ass!: The Drunk Edition

226424.name: Stern Pinball Arcade
226424.description:
User Summary
A spin-off from The Pinball Arcade, this game includes previously released tables by Stern, Sega & Data East (Ripley's Believe it or Not, Mary Shelley's Frankenstein, Starship Troopers, Harley Davidson: Third Edition, Last Action Hero, High Roller Casino & Phantom of the Opera) as well as brand new Stern tables (Star Trek: Vengeance Premium Edition, Star Trek: Enterprise Limited Edition, AC/DC Premium Edition, AC/DC: Let There be Rock Limited Edition, AC/DC: Back in Black Limited Edition & Mustang: Boss Premium Edition).
Ripley's Believe it or Not & Harley Davidson were previously released on the PlayStation 4 disc The Pinball Arcade (Season 1). All other tables on this disc are available in a physical format for the first time.

226426.name: Valerian: The Alpha Missions
226426.description:
Valerian: The Alpha Missions gives fans of tabletop gaming and the Valerian franchise the opportunity to discover Alpha, a vast metropolis in which species from across the universe gather over centuries to share knowledge, intelligence, and cultures. After assembling a team of agents, players must cooperate to explore a contested zone of Alpha, race to complete objectives while battling and evading enemies. Complete the missions and get to the extraction site in time to win!

The game board consists of randomly placed tiles that are revealed as agents move around the map, creating a unique experience each game. Players will never know who or what they might encounter – enemies could attack or players may discover valuable resources to power their mission gear. Each player must decide whether to split up and accomplish their objectives faster or sacrifice valuable resources to save their teammates. As the clock runs down and enemies gain ground, only the most skilled team of agents will complete their missions to return as heroes.

226427.name: The Warlock for Swords & Wizardry
226427.description:
From publisher blurb:

Power!

It is what calls to mortals to make them seek out otherworldly creatures just for a taste. The power of the Warlock is the power they seek. But are they willing to pay the price?

The Warlock includes:

The Warlock class
New race: The Teiflings
Rules for goblin, hobgoblin and bugbear warlocks
160+ spells
50+ Warlock invocations
New monsters including the Baalseraph, Calabim, Lilim and Shedim demon groups.
Animal Lords and Faerie Lords
New magic Items

226428.name: Passage
226428.description:
From publisher blurb:

The heroes discover a derelict adrift in the cold loneliness of interstellar space. Aboard they find murder, mystery, and a cargo more fabulous than they’ve ever imagined.

Passage is a one-page, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) and starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

226429.name: GM's Monthly Miscellany (May 2017)
226429.description:
From publisher blurb:

Featuring material from some of Raging Swan Press’s newest products as well as classic releases of yesteryear, advice articles and material from Creighton’s on-going design of the megadungeon Gloamhold, the GM’s Monthly Miscellany series is a terrific free resource for the busy, time-crunched GM.

This month’s issue features:

20 Pieces of Hill Giant Steading Dressing (from 20 Things #14: Hill Giant Steading)
Quey’s Glade At A Glance (from Village Backdrop: Quey’s Glade)
Dunstone at a Glance (from Town Backdrop: Dunstone)
Hill Giants Aplenty (a collection of stat blocks)
Down with Point Buy and Dump Stats!

226430.name: Avatar
226430.description:
From publisher blurb:

Is it possible for low-self esteem and the constant media barrage of unachievable body image to give someone super powers? Or perhaps such things just crafted the result of the manifestation of Laura's latent mutant abilities? Whatever the true cause, plain jane Laura is now able to psychically create a new, "perfect" body for herself - complete with super powers.

The outgoing, super powered heroine AVATAR stands out in all the ways Laura could otherwise only dream of. But is she really free in this form or just another part of the problem?

226431.name: Brainchild
226431.description:
From publisher blurb:

When Bethany discovered that her cousin was actually the glamorous super heroine AVATAR, she became her biggest fan. She also began trying to discover if her genetic relation to AVATAR meant that she, too, could conjure up the perfect version of herself... to no avail.

Her disappointment turned into resentment and jealousy. She began scheming to make AVATAR look bad. She made plan after plan to show the world that AVATAR didn't empower women, at all.

Her strong emotions eventually triggered the mutation she originally failed to awaken. Now, in her own "perfect" body, BRAINCHILD uses her powers to not only take AVATAR down a peg or two, but to lash out at all superficial people who made life for people like her so unbearable!

226432.name: Hill Giant Steading
226432.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your session to life? Well fear not! That’s where the 20 Things line comes in. Compiled from the free 20 Things posts available at Raging Swan’s website, this short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your adventure. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation. This instalment provides six tables designed to help you to flesh out and bring to life a noisome sewer.

20 Things #14: Hill Giant Steading comprises the following 20 Things articles, along with other supplementary material:

10 Minor Hill Giant Steading Events
10 Things to Find Near a Hill Giant Steading
20 Thing to Find in a Hill Giant’s Bag
20 Pieces of Hill Giant Steading Dressing
100 Hill Giant Pets
1,000 Abnormal Hill Giants

226433.name: Monsters
226433.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monsters can be killed. They are horrifying, deadly, and often implacable, but they die. That is the grim hope upon which SAVE is built.

—Dr. Ruby Garrett, Report on Monsters

Monsters is an antagonist book for Chill® Third Edition, detailing creatures of the Unknown that don’t fit neatly into other categories. In this book, you’ll find 15 new creatures of the Unknown, as well as in-depth discussions of how these creatures fit into the world of Chill®. Also included are new pregenerated characters and new Edges and Drawbacks for use in your Chill® games.

226434.name: A Lamp Gone Dark
226434.description:
From Introduction:

A threat SAVE contained decades ago re-emerges. Preying on the dead, the weak and the young, this creature now operates in an ideal nest: St. Virgilius Hospital. Will the envoys defeat a monster they can’t see? Will they fall prey to interference from hospital administration seeking to cover up the creature’s actions?

226435.name: Big Sky
226435.description:
From Introduction:

Out on the prairie, family secrets are buried deep. When the howls echo over the land, do the envoys have the courage to do what must be done?

226436.name: El Cucuy Came for Carlito
226436.description:
From Introduction:

Ancient Hispanic myths tell of El Cucuy, the mysterious boogeyman who steals away children. In southern Texas children are beginning to vanish in unexplained ways. Has the myth of El Cucuy become a reality, or is something more sinister at play?

226437.name: Temple of the Skin Man
226437.description:
From Introduction:

Something is scratching at the oubliette underneath the Upended Lotus Temple. A plague has befallen the surrounding town. Can SAVE stop the Skin Man before it is too late?

226438.name: Let Sleeping Dogs Lie
226438.description:
From Introduction:

A string of disappearances in a mountain town are marked with paw prints seared into solid rock. SAVE has seen this omen before, and knows it is only a matter of time before people start dying horribly.

226439.name: OneDice Hauntaway
226439.description:
From publisher blurb:

Quick and easy rules for humorous ghost hunting!

Ghosties and ghoulies
And long-legged beasties
And things that go bump in the night

When they started manifesting again, it was the big franchises that moved in first. Ghostbursters, with their slick marketing and sing-along tunes. G6S, with their reputation for locking things up. Exorcisms-R-Us, endorsed by the Pope.

And then there’s us. Hauntaway. Our Eldritch Exterminators are the best trained and the worst paid in the business. We’re cheap. We’re that little shop between the off-license and the chip-shop, that mostly seems to be closed. We have another branch in a kiosk at the back of the big DIY store on the industrial estate.

You’ve got a ghostly poodle that’s haunting your grandma? We’re on it. Strange knocking in the walls that might be bad plumbing? We’ll sort it. We just got a contract from the local council to exorcise every old people’s home in the county. We’ll manage it, somehow.

Hauntaway – we’ll bring your spirits down!

226440.name: Born to Kill
226440.description:
From publisher blurb:

Victims of the Demon Lord

Born to Kill joins the other installments of the Victims of the Demon Lord by presenting orcs in all their blood-soaked glory. In the following pages, you’ll find more information about the orcs’ origins, their place in their world, and how they won their liberation. Furthermore, Born to Kill offers variant character creation rules to produce highly detailed orc characters, as well as a brutal new expert path: the ravager!

226441.name: Fields of Arle: Tea & Trade
226441.description: Tea & Trade is the first expansion of Fields of Arle. It introduces a new resource "Tea", ships and trading destinations for those, an additional craft action "Ditcher" and several new buildings. A 3-player mode is included in the expansion as well.

226442.name: The Humid Harvest
226442.description:
User summary:

Presents general information on The Slog, a wilderness area that can be dropped into any overland travel route.

226443.name: Hostage Negotiator: Abductor Pack 8
226443.description: Hostage Negotiator: Abductor Pack 8 is a 16-card expansion compatible with both Hostage Negotiator and Hostage Negotiator: Crime Wave.

226445.name: The Big Score
226445.description:
The vault at New Centennial Bank is currently rumored to be holding a record amount of cash, precious jewels, ancient artifacts, and highly-sensitive digital intel. As the boss of one of the city’s most notorious crime organizations, robbing that vault for all it’s worth is constantly on your mind. There’s only one problem. This job is too big for just your crew alone. You’re going to need help from some of your biggest rival crime bosses if you want to succeed. You’ll need to join forces on a series of smaller jobs in order to acquire the skills and resources you'll need to pull off the biggest heist the city has ever seen. But watch your back! Once you and your new partners in crime are inside the bank vault, it'll be every boss for himself. Hire your crew, plan the heist, and get ready for The Big Score!

The Big Score is a competitive game for 1-5 players that plays in 30-60 minutes. The game is structured into two distinct halves. In the first half of the game, players will use card drafting to carefully choose which specialists to add to their crew. They will secretly decide how to assign them to various small heists throughout the city, and they’ll need to pick just the right moment to send in their most skilled expert to ensure a job’s success! If these plans go well, players will steal a variety of loot: cold hard cash, jewels that escalate in value as more are gained, artifacts that are profitable for the player with the largest collection, and hard drives full of intel that become lucrative only if hacked with a digital key. In the second half of the game, individual player abilities will come into play as the players attempt the mother of all heists, The Big Score. Players will risk being busted by the cops as they steal even more loot in an exciting, press-your-luck grand finale inside the New Centennial Bank vault!

The Big Score also features a challenging solo-play mode designed by A.J. Porfirio (Hostage Negotiator).

226446.name: Thistle Hold: Wrath of the Warden - Game Master Resource
226446.description:
From the introduction:

This document contains many revelations regarding the adventure Thistle Hold: Wrath of the Warden and is only meant for GMs to read.

User summary:

This item contains primarily full-page, full-color print-and-play components, including maps, non-player character illustrations, and player handouts.

226447.name: Dragon Magic
226447.description:
From the introduction:

One of the first creatures to master all types of magic was the majestic and terrible dragon. While their very essences were capable of controlling the elements and radiating powerful fear, they also mastered more subtle magic.

226448.name: Guilty Gear Xrd REV 2
226448.description:
Guilty Gear Xrd REV 2 includes new fighters, moves, story chapters and more! It’s never been a better time to be a 2.5D brawler in the post apocalypse! Hone your skills with an eclectic cast of 25 insane fighters and prove your mettle as the ultimate fighting master.

Source: The Game Website.

226449.name: Elven High Magic
226449.description:
From the introduction:

Legends say that the elves of ancient times could enchant entire cities, change fate, and even reshape worlds, with a power that nearly infringed upon the authority of the gods. These feats are unheard of today, and most non-elves believe elven high magic has died out. But this power still exists, as a closely guarded secret practiced only by the elves and their shadow fey relatives.

226450.name: Isla Boca Muerte
226450.description:
From the introduction:

Isla Boca Muerte (Death’s Mouth Island) is an 8 mile long island off the coast of Peru. In the early part of the 20th century it was used for mining diamonds but now it is owned by Nypton Ind. This company has built a large resort on the island. Several guests have been invited to the luxury hotel, aquarium, zoo, and spa to experience the island first hand.

226451.name: Double Cross Country Dash
226451.description:
From the introduction:

You’re going to be rich. Seriously rich. Miles away there’s a small fortune waiting for you, if you can get there in time. Of course it’s not just you. You’ve got your souped up engine. You’ve got your driving buddy. And you’ve got several car loads of competitors with exactly the same plan as you.

It’ll take determination, it’ll take talent, it’ll take speed and it may take a few broken rules, broken speed limited and broken promises to get there first. But we all know nice guys finish last.

What would you rather be – nice or rich beyond your wildest dreams?

Exactly!

226452.name: Documentary Now
226452.description:
From the introduction:

All you wanted to do was produce a nice, educational documentary. But now your financial backers are making demands about content. When crew members aren’t high, they’re fighting. Someone’s dad is wandering around giving you lighting advice. And there seems to be a family of marmosets living in your trailer.

You just want to scream, "For the love... of God. Can we please... just shoot... the Documentary now?!"

226453.name: Fiasco in New Crobuzon
226453.description:
From the introduction:

Secret lovers make out furtively in the shadow of The Ribs, while sordid drug deals that could bring the City to its knees take place in the hovel behind them. A bitter-faced cactacae cocks his rivebow in a back alley before rampaging against the militiamen who killed his comrade in cold blood. That smell emanating from Salacus Fields has been there a week, and rumors have begun to spread about its terrifying origin. Better find a way to keep your head down, though that only works so long...

226454.name: Chawaï
226454.description: Dive into a lagoon in Chawaï and try to bring back the most delicious fish before your fellow fishers can.

226455.name: Cut Throats, Killers & Scoundrels: Jewel Freehold
226455.description:
From publisher blurb:

Jewel was once the daughter of elven nobility. Arrogance brought them low after a disaster and the only one she could turn to were the 'Blossoms.' Now trained as an assassin and infiltrator, Jewel hides in plain sight. She is waiting for the perfect time to strike and reclaim all that should be hers.

Each volume of Cut Throats, Killers, and Scoundrals provides individual characters for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Each volume provides a detailed character for use by either Gamemasters or players, and can be easily integrated into your games.

226456.name: The Beetle Knight
226456.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Beetle knight was once a great and renowned dwarven knight with a suite of unique and magical armor. His legend revered and tomb visited by dwarven pilgrims wishing to follow in his famous footsteps. . . . BUUUUUUUTTTTTTT . . . . not everyone holds the tomb of the Beetle Knight in quite that sacred of a regard . . .

Included in this spotlight is three iterations of the Beetle Knight for your heroes to fight. I know he used to be a good guy, but y’know . . . stuff happens. The three different versions of the Beetle Knight vastly range in power and tactics to ensure a vast variety of encounters. Also, all three versions of the Beetle Knight can be tied into a single story arch.

What would the Beetle Knight be without the Beetle Knight armor? Not the Beetle Knight! So also included in this evildoer Spotlight are the stats for the magical Beetle Knight armor. The armor is unique and how its awarded is up to you the GM, so have fun with how you introduce it into your game.

The Beetle Knight’s are intended to be used against heroes whose levels range between 6-12 and depending on how the final version of the Beetle Knight is used & the types of creatures paired with him, this could pose a threat to up to 15th level heroes!

226457.name: Magnificent Flying Machines
226457.description:
This game takes inspiration from the great air races of circa 1908 to 1913 which took place in the pioneering era of Air travel. These air races galvanised interest across the world and encouraged by generous prizes by Newspapers and other sponsors attracted international entries. Air travel was risky and most unreliable. Often only a small number of the entrants would make it to the finish line. Will one of your pilots manage to face up to the challenge? But watch out: In this era of gentlemanly behaviour and stiff upper lips there are a few cads and bounders who will cheat to win.

In Magnificent Flying Machines the winner is the person who ends the game with the most victory points. These can be earned in various ways including being the first to land successfully on a certain terrain tile, landing on the middle airfield, transporting cargo or passengers or performing trick maneuvers. Simply being the first to cross the finishing line is unlikely to be enough on its own to secure a victory. The winner will be the player who picks a strategy that best matches the abilities of the pilot and features of the flying machine they are using.

The game is played in a series of rounds. A round begins with the first player taking a turn. Each player takes their turn in order clockwise around the table. During a turn a player has two action phases available. There are three types of action phase to choose from. These are The takeoff phase (which may also include refueling, repairing and scavenging spare parts),The flying phase (which may also include gaining altitude and performing trick maneuvers), The landing phase (which may also include refuelling). In addition whenever a flying machine lands on a terrain tile any passengers that wish to will disembark), and any cargo intended for that terrain type is unloaded. It may also take on available equipment, cargo and passengers if there is space available to do so.

Players progress in the game by passing a series of takeoff, flying and landing tests. To determine the difficulty of a particular test, first look at the number of symbols for that test shown on the terrain tile that the flying machine is on. Simply add the number of symbols shown on the terrain tile to the number of symbols on the relevant weather tile. If a player needs to take a test, first check to see the total number of relevant symbols shown on the flying machine dashboard. This is the number of dice that may be rolled when attempting to obtain a sufficient number of symbols to pass the test. If the player does not roll enough symbols they may then choose to make use of special equipment, use spare parts, or play trick and boost cards to obtain additional symbols in order to pass the test. If a player is unable to obtain a sufficient number of symbols to pass the test then a failure occurs. If the dice rolled include a catastrophic failure symbol, then a catastrophic failure occurs. The effects of such a failure vary depending on the test being taken.

226458.name: Revised Subclasses
226458.description:
From the introduction:

This document presents revised versions of five subclasses that appeared in earlier installments of Unearthed Arcana. Each subclass was popular, and the revisions to it were driven by feedback that thousands of you provided in surveys.

The subclasses are the barbarian’s Path of the Ancestral Guardian, the bard’s College of Swords, the fighter’s Arcane Archer, the monk’s Way of the Kensei, and the sorcerer’s Favored Soul.

226459.name: Kriegs-Spiel
226459.description:
This is a two-player German war game published in about 1880. The playing board features a castle in the center surrounded by a two-layer multi-colored track running from 1-70. On each side is rectangular block of colored numbers, with 1-35 on one side and 36-70 on the other. There are illustrations of fighting in the four corners, with uniforms representing the then-recent Franco-Prussian war of 1870-71.

To start, the players each put an agreed amount into the pot to fund the war. They then take turns rolling a single die, and advancing that many spaces on their respective tracks. The first to reach space 70 wins the war and the pot.

The color of each space has an effect on play. If a player lands on a green space, the opponent must drop back to the nearest red space. A player who lands on a blue space must pay one mark to his opponent. Landing on a gold space means paying a mark into the pot, while landing on a lilac space grants another roll of the die.

The board consists of a sheet of paper pasted onto thick cardboard. A second game is pasted onto the reverse side.

226461.name: Ogre Gate Inn and the Strange Land of Li Fan
226461.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

In the strange borderlands of the empire you will find Li Fan, an ancient kingdom of ghosts, lost ghosts, lost techniques, and magic. Here, nobles may rule but powerful Kung Fu masters truly reign supreme.

User summary:

Scheduled to ship in June 2017.

226462.name: Toxic Alley
226462.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

Dark plots and darker magic frequently converge in the capital of the UCAS, and those forces are revving up again. Toxic Alley launches plotlines involving toxic mages, shedim, and other dark forces, while building on elements from the Sith World Tarot and Book of the Lost. Runners will have as much as they can handle keeping up with the chaos filling the back alleys of DeeCee!

User summary:

Scheduled to ship in July 2017.

226463.name: Fully Operational
226463.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

A sourcebook for Engineers, Fully Operational introduces three new specialized talent trees and new races to populate your campaigns, and includes detailed rules for vehicle and starship construction as well as sample campaigns that emphasize the role Engineers play in the Galactic Civil War. A livery of new ships also awaits you.

User summary:

Scheduled to ship in June 2017.

226464.name: Castle Assault: The Fell Fire Forge
226464.description:
Castle Assault is a unique gaming experience combining the ferocious onslaught of Tower Defense games with the strategic elements of CCGs and progressive advancement of RPG's. Castle Assault seeks to break the mold of traditional card games and organically extracts the most enjoyable parts of these different genres and distill them into a standalone concept. Castle Assault plays in about 30 mins, and is for 1 or 2 Players.

Draft warbands, upgrade heroes and craft legendary weapons as you battle an inferno of horrors on an epic quest to forge your destiny. As a 100% stand alone Castle Assault expansion that can be 100% integrated into Castle Assault, the Fell Fire Forge introduces 4 new Warbands and an completely epic, non-linear branching solo campaign like you have never seen!

226465.name: The Maze of Games
226465.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Maze of Games is a full-length puzzle novel with over 50 puzzles and a deeply engaging story, all woven together in a "solve your own adventure" style which will keep you jumping from page to page.

The main characters are teenagers Colleen and Samuel Quaice, who live in England in the year 1897. During a visit to the Upper Wolverhampton Library, they discover a musty book called The Maze of Games. This summons a mysterious skeletal guardian named the Gatekeeper, who plunges them into a series of dangerous mazes rife with monsters and bizarre puzzles.

Only by solving their way through the mazes will the Quaice children find their way home.

226466.name: The Theseus Guide to the Final Maze
226466.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

A companion volumes offering hints to guide readers through The Maze of Games to find the final answer.

226467.name: Pathfinder Flip-Mat: Arcane Library
226467.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

Whether you're searching for a missing spellbook amid a pile of moldy tomes or pillaging an eccentric wizard's lair, Arcane Library has you covered.

User summary:

Schedule to ship in July 2017.

226468.name: Blood of the Sea
226468.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

Whether from the lightless depths of ocean trenches or azure tropical seas, heroes rise from beneath the waves in Blood of the Sea! Explore the mystical paths and strange abilities of seaborn adventurers - and those who hunt them.

User summary:

Schedule to ship in July 2017.

226469.name: Lankhmar: City of Thieves Collector's Box Set
226469.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

This Collector's Box Set contains softcover editions of:

User summary:


Lankhmar: City of Thieves
Lankhmar: Savage Tales of the Thieves Guild
Lankhmar: Savage Foes of Nehwon
Lankhmar GM Screen and The Eyes of Goro'mosh Adventure
Lankhmar: City of Lankhmar Map
Lankhmar: World of Newhon Map
Lankhmar Bennies
Lankhmar Dice Set


Schedule to ship in June 2017.

226470.name: Voyage of Our Own
226470.description:
Today is finally your day!
The emperor finally granted you a permit and even a ship!

In your anticipation you rush to see your magnificent ship and find...

Your 3 rivals already arguing over whose voyage it is!!

In A Voyage of Our Own, you play an intrepid explorer
forced to share their ship with 1-3 other explorers to explore an unknown archipelago.
Can you claim more credit for the voyages success?

Or will one of the other explorers steal the glory for
themselves?

...Set sail and adventure east to the Vooo islands.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
Voyage of Our Own is a light strategy exploration game. Players share the ship's crew to earn more credit for the voyage. This is done by placing and exploring islands, laying claims on tiles, and collecting tiles in their hands.

Credit is earned by discovering islands, claiming tiles, and gathering sets of trade goods. The player with the most credit at the end of the game wins.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Voyage of Our Own contains
24 Hex tiles.
2 Crew
1 Board
1 Cool down chip
60 Claims (15 in 4 colours)

226471.name: Wired Neon Cities - Minimalist Cyberpunk Roleplaying
226471.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Welcome to Glow City, where the corporations will beat you down as much as the gangs. Cyberninjas patrol the neon streets with katanas, the Iron Maidens roam the roads with chains and chop shops are filled with the poor and bored who want to alter their bodies beyond their wildest dreams. Hulking sentries guard the gleaming skyscrapers of the elite and psycho juicers drop adrenaline before holding up convenience stores.

Wired Neon Cities is a minimalist cyberpunk roleplaying game that uses the In Darkest Warrens system. Think a 1980's style future with a chiptune theme. All rules are covered in just two sides of A4, while setting details and a character sheet fit onto another page. Despite its brevity, these rules contain everything you need to play, including an enemies list, augmentations, hacking rules and more.

Wired Neon Cities includes:

A simple d6 system that allows for flexibility in roleplaying
Setting information for Glow City
Six classes: Cyberninja, Hacker, Gunner, Mechanic, Face and Doc
A list of enemies
Augment your character with derm shields, voice modulators, flame throwers, arm blades and more.

226472.name: Walk Among the Dead
226472.description:
From the designer's notes:

I like ghosts and ghost stories. I thought of this game after I played “Old Friends” by Jason Morningstar and Ole Peder Giaever at Fastaval. It’s a mix of a séance, the myth of Orpheus and Euridice, and a murderous ghost story.

From a judges description:

Walk Among the Dead is a freeform game about questioning the dead. Players take turns wearing a mask and risking their life to find closure with the one they lost while the others play [mostly] truthful ghosts whispering back. The game accommodates various group sizes and range of potential stories while maintaining focus on its premise and giving players clear instructions about what they should be doing. - Marshall Miller

This game was a finalist in the 200 Word RPG Challenge 2016

226473.name: Survival of the Femmest
226473.description:
This is a simple game where characters fight the gross monsters attacking their colony with nothing but cosmetics.

This game was a finalist in the 200 Word RPG Challenge 2016.

226474.name: Stop Hiding Your Crush
226474.description:
From the game's intro:

A game 3-6 players about fear of rejection and the joy of revealed love.

You are a polyamorous teenager at a party. The irrelevant people have gone home, or passed out. All that’s left is your circle and its tangled web. Will your secret crush return your love?

This game was a finalist in the 200 Word RPG Challenge 2016.

226475.name: Recovery
226475.description:
Life is a constant battle between you and your addiction. Recovery is a game that focuses on the journey to a successful or unsuccessful recovery from addiction.

This game was a finalist in the 200 Word RPG Challenge 2016.

226476.name: Rad Hacker Vampires
226476.description:
Rad Hacker Vampires is a simple game where you play a cybersmith vampire with clipped black wings and broken nails. You run a blood-mad hacker crew.

It is inspired by “The World, The Flesh and The Devil” by Paul Czege and “Force Blade Punk” by Grant Howitt.

This game was a finalist in the 200 Word RPG Challenge 2016.

226477.name: Paranormal Rescue Squad
226477.description:
Paranormal Rescue squad uses characterisation and improv, leaving plenty of room for players to sketch out a dangerous and unknown conspiracy and discover it organically through play.

This game was a finalist in the 200 Word RPG Challenge 2016.

226478.name: Out Of The Crucible, A Fire
rpg: Out Of The Crucible, A Fire
226478.description:
From the game's description:

You are a party of adventurers from your favorite Fantasy RPG, fresh off a dungeon crawl. You decompress around the campfire before going to sleep. Play as a standalone game or debrief in character after a longer gaming session.

It uses logs in a campfire as a timer.

This game was a finalist in the 200 Word RPG Challange 2016.

226479.name: White Box Zombies
226479.description:
From the Publisher:

...WHITE BOX ZOMBIES, your guide to a zombie apocalypse in a fantasy setting.

226480.name: FIASCON
226480.description:
From the introduction:

You think you can undertake the organization of any project, be it a convention, a conference or a live-action roleplaying game. You think you will work your fingers to the bone to make sure everything will work out as well as possible. You think you will try to do the impossible and make sure everything is prepared on time. But there is only one law - more difficult than any organization or behavior - the law of averages.

Do you think your project is different from the rest? Don't be naïve. Nothing you do will ever really shine. Do you know why? Because you are a crappy organizer.

226481.name: Fiasco Blood Bowl
226481.description:
User summary:

This bare-bones playset presents a fantasy football league - not "fantasy football", but a football league set in a fantasy genre. Players can expect violence and, occasionally, players eating other players on the field.

Turn it up until the knob falls off!

226483.name: Escape From Cloud City
226483.description:
From the introduction:

Cloud City has always operated on the fringe of the law, but its tibanna gas mining has kept its Baron Administrators wealthy and powerful enough to preserve the city’s autonomy. Even Palpatine’s overreaching galactic empire has kept its hands off of the city’s not strictly-legal operations, making the Bespin city something of a haven for ambitious entrepreneurs, gamblers, and miscreants.

However, rumors have begun to spread of Imperial transports landing in the city. Some even report Darth Vader himself has been meeting with Baron Administrator Calrissian. Tensions are running high, and the city of six million waits on edge. Is it time to pick up and leave the planet, or is there time for one last score?

226484.name: Hit the Mattresses!
226484.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A fiasco set against the backdrop of war between two rival Mafia families in a major (but unspecified) American city.

226485.description:
Zuirius is a strategic board game played on an endless triangular grid. It is possible to play on any flat surface, without the special board. The goal of the game is to block all tetrahedrons of your rival.

In this game there is no captures or direct confrontation of pieces. During the game the number of pieces is not changed, all tetrahedrons are interconnected and constantly depend on each other. The compact starting position of pieces passes through various irreversible metamorphoses and, having exhausted all its "energy", freezes as a result. You can play with 18, 24, 30, 36 or 42 pieces. The more pieces, the harder the game will be.

Rules:

Each player has an allocated color. Players alternate turns. All tetrahedrons must be connected in a single group. You cannot pick up a piece to move if doing so disconnects the remaining pieces, even if they would be reconnected after putting the piece into its new location. Each tetrahedron always has neighbors. Their number can be from 1 to 12. Tetrahedrons are considered to be neighbors if they stand on the nearby triangles. Neighbors are divided into two types - orthogonal and diagonal. The piece can be moved to any empty triangle, where the number of neighbors are less than it is now. Their color does not matter. The piece can also be moved to any empty triangle, where the number of neighbors does not change, but orthogonal ones among them become less. The game ends when one of the players has no legal moves on his turn. In this case, the winner does as many moves as he can and earns one point for each move. When both players lose moves consecutively it's a draw.
226485.name: Zuirius

226486.name: Monopoly: Guardians of the Galaxy Volume 2
226486.description: This game is a version of Monopoly with the theme from the 2017 movie Guardians of the Galaxy Volume 2 directed by James Gunn. This game has custom game board features characters from both films, 6 collectible custom tokens, and custom houses and hotels that are renamed as "gear" and "equipment".

226488.name: Jadetech: Multi-Jade
226488.description:
Publisher blurb:

Jadetech: Multi-Jade is the final installment in the Jadetech supplement series for the Jadepunk: Tales From Kausao City roleplaying game.

In this digital supplement, you will find everything you need to outfit your Jianghu hero with Jadetech devices that take advantage of all five colors of jade. Filled with plot hooks for your games, this is more than just an equipment supplement; it's an add-on for the setting of Jadepunk.

Jade is at the core of the Jadepunk setting. If you are a fan of Jadepunk, you don't want to miss the Jadetech series.

226490.name: Monopoly Junior: Finding Dory edition
226490.description:
An edition of Monopoly Junior, with Disney/Pixar Finding Dory theme, that features exclusive Finding Dory tokens. The game is like the classic Monopoly game but easier for kids. And it features properties from Disney/Pixar Finding Dory Movie.

Includes:
•Gameboard
•4 Character tokens
•24 Chance cards
•48 Character Markers
•90 Monopoly banknotes
•1 Die
•Instructions

226491.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Beyond The Wall Promo Cards
boardgameversion: White Box Promo - Bexond the Wall
226491.description:
This White Box Expansion includes a small vignette depicting Aya the Survivor in dangerous times. This expansion also includes the remaining two gear cards that complete the Vagabond Armor set from 'Before the Wall'.

The gear cards are crafted via recipes printed on the back of them.

These gear cards are:

Hard Breastplate
Leather/Vagabond Set Torso Heavy Armor (3 Armor points)
Affinities: Top; Red Half, Bottom; Blue Half
Automatically Activated ability: Green + Blue Affinity required: Ignore the first severe injury you suffer each showdown

Cloth Leggings:
Vagabond Set Leg Accessory (Legs, 1 Armor)
Affinities: Bottom, Green Half
Passive Ability: When you suffer the Bleeding or Bloody Thighs severe injury, only gain 1 bleeding token)

Note: Cloth Leggings use the starting item 'Cloth' gear card to craft them.

226492.name: 1705: El desembarcament
226492.description:
Card game based in the landing of Austriacist troops in Montgat (near Barcelona) in 1705, during the War of the Spanish Succession.

The aim of the players is to get 10 points, playing the best sets of cards. At the peginning of a game, each player gets a special permanent character, which gives some special power). Then from a draw pile, in each turn, a player draws a card and plays as many cards as he wants in his playing area, trying to play the best sets, to either get points or to destroy card sets already played by other players.

226494.name: Fey
226494.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fairies Both Friendly and Fearsome!

Mythic Monsters: Fey brings you an awesome array of mysterious and magical creatures from the realms of Faerie. These capricious creatures range from CR 1 to CR 20 and include monsters malevolent and benign. Some fey are helpful spirits, from the industrious brownie to the far-striding fastachee cultivating their corn, or the musical grigs fiddling in the night. Others have far more sinister intentions, from anguished fiend-blooded forlarren to sadistic tooth fairies. Like them, gremlins come in many shapes and sizes, all of them notorious from pugnacious nuglub thugs to vengeful jinkin saboteurs. Many fey simply wish to be left alone, like sprites and sprite swarms guarding the wild and beautiful places of the world from intrusion, or the serene and beautiful hamadryad queens who rule the forests. Mortals may seek to bargain with the fey, but woe betide any who double-cross a blood-hungry sangoi or a darkling vilderavn raven knight! As if a dozen existing monsters were not enough, the brand-new horzitoth is a nonesuch, an urban fey that devours dreams and feasts on fatigue, and savoring the loss of sleep for those who welcome it into their homes as an uninvited guest. In addition to the featured creatures, we bring you the fabulous fey-bound knight prestige class, perfect for those heroes of might and magic who have sought service with the lords and ladies of the fey realms!

226495.name: Helfire Mountain
226495.description:
From publisher blurb:

For 4-6 Adventurers of Levels 7-9

A doomsday cult opened a portal within Helfire Mountain, unleashing an elemental lord upon the realm. There’s a chance of sending him back, however it requires access to the portal and the portal is well guarded.

Helfire Mountain is part of a series of mini-dungeons designed to drop into existing adventures or campaigns. Use them as side quests or a way of getting in a quick adventure when you’re short on time.

226496.name: Arcana Journal (Issue 95 - Mar 2017)
226496.description:
From publisher blurb:

The true wonders of Arcana are explored in the monthly journals. Each issue focuses on a hex or faction within the game world, offering rumors, hidden lore, and detailed descriptions of all the important sites and people. Full-color maps (also offered in print-easy black and white) are provided, plus all sites of worthwhile note, such as towns and major adventure sites. Floor plans of castles and other locations are also offered.

In addition to this detailed write-up, each issue will also focus on other aspects of the game world, its history, important people, the Magi and gaming classes. When you add it all up, these journals take the mundane and make it magical. It is through the journals that the Arcana game world will grow, expand, and become a living place of adventure.

This issue of the Journal will cover the following aspects of the game world.

House Kilmorth
Tarot Deck of Ner, Major Arcane Part 1

226497.name: Arcana Journal (Issue 96 - Mar 2017)
226497.description:
From publisher blurb:

The true wonders of Arcana are explored in the monthly journals. Each issue focuses on a hex or faction within the game world, offering rumors, hidden lore, and detailed descriptions of all the important sites and people. Full-color maps (also offered in print-easy black and white) are provided, plus all sites of worthwhile note, such as towns and major adventure sites. Floor plans of castles and other locations are also offered.

In addition to this detailed write-up, each issue will also focus on other aspects of the game world, its history, important people, the Magi and gaming classes. When you add it all up, these journals take the mundane and make it magical. It is through the journals that the Arcana game world will grow, expand, and become a living place of adventure.

This issue of the Journal will cover the following aspects of the game world.

House Lomm
Tarot Deck of Ner, Major Arcane Part 2
Marcos the Magus

226498.name: The Bruised Knuckles of Freedom!
226498.description:
From publisher blurb:

Reality Cheque's One-Sheets are adventures and supplements that can be printed out on a single sheet of letter-sized paper. The adventures are short, simple scenarios or encounters that can be run on their own, or dropped into an ongoing campaign to shake things up.

Fists up: Who likes punching Nazis? If you raised your hand; you do know I can't see you, right?

226500.name: Alle meine Tiere
226500.description:
Discover, assign and count domestic animals.
It's a tiptoi game for very young players (3 year olds).

Where does the fox live? And what does the hedgehog really love to eat? How well do you know about horses, cats ...?
With the game "All My Animals" and the tiptoi device you will learn a lot about domestic animals, their habitats, their animal children, and you can playfully get to know more about numbers.
